reviews.review: Meydan!!. Absolutely fantastic horse racing facility that is open to the public. Public has free entry to races, raffles. Entire families attend and have a family outing. Seating is plentiful and seats i.e. view is fabulous. Meydan Hotel next door is great for drinks and appetizers and one can view the race from the balcony. Prices are high for instance an expresso is AED 25, beer is AED 48. Shisha available too. Service is fantastic.

Great night. Lovely evening spent in the winners restaurant watching the racing - food good service quick and efficient - complexities of Dubai racing raffle expertly explained - definitely will be coming back
Superb. If watching horse race is your thing then this place is like the ideal place for you to spend your day.
Awesome Racing Experience. An awesome racing experience in pure granduer and luxury. Whatever they do, they do it LARGE here in Dubai. A must visit for visitors to Dubai, if the racing season is on.
Amazing Place. If you love racing, this is the place to go.The course is amazing, perfect view seats and VIP treatment.

A guide tour of Meydan. We had a guided tour of Meydan,what a fantastic experiance.Mark made the tour even more special with his vast knowledge& passion for racing at Meydan.We had an inside of how the stables operate on an every day basis also a special mention to Brian.A trip not to be missed for the racing enthusiast.
Entertaing Evening. Fantastic facility well worth a visit even if you arent really into horse racing although that does help. Free entry to certain areas and always seems to be a good crowd there.
Impressive. Have been to the Maydan hotel rooftop function area for a Gala Dinner and it was overlooking the race course. The whole facility is impressive.

A day at the races. You put on your best shoes and your favourite hat and you head on out to Meydan Racecourse. The feeling you get standing there overlooking those magnificent beasts run, gives you a feeling of complete elevation. The facalities at Meydan can be compared to that of the rest of Dubai: unprecedented. Treat yourself, have a look at their private party packages and go enjoy something very special and in any other part of the world probably more exclusive, making the Meydan a uniquely inviting experience.

equine athletes performing. Meydan race course is near to Dubai area. Race entry to general admission is free to publice except Dubai world cup day (end of march). You can go with your family and children and watch world's best equine athletes performing. The race will start from November 2016.

Spectacular but needs care and attention. The racecourse and the races are magnificent but parts of the building fabric are disappointing. There needs to be some work done to keep the building exterior as spectacular as the design It was great to see it in Star Trek too.

Beautiful horses, Thrilling races. We went there for one of the races, I don't remember which one but we have full access and could view the horses from up close and fell in love with each one of them. The Arabian horses are majestic and you can see it from up close and in action and what a sight it is.

So close and yet so far. This has to be, structurally and aesthetically, the best racecourse in the world today. Yet....other than World Cup night, it leaves much to be desired in terms of atmosphere. I attended Super Saturday and it was a crying shame that arriving with no organised plan, my colleague and I were sold a very expensive hospitality package into a VIP enclosure that easily catered for over 150 people and yet had an entire total number of 2 for half the race meeting, when we were then joined by another 8. The racing was superb, the prize money on offer incredible, the quality of horses on display world class - yet the atmosphere was flatter than a midweek meeting at the Vaal in South Africa or some resolute English country side course.So much potential and yet so little delivery in terms of customer experience.I will go again - for the horses and for World Cup night - but will have to do some serious research into where I land up, if I am to go on any other night other than the big one.

Well worth booking. We booked a trip to visit the Meydan and a tour of the stables. Very informative and to see how well the horses are looked after, you are served breakfast when you get there and you can watch some of the horses on the gallops.

Can be visited countless times and great for all the family!. I've visited Meydan annually for the past 4 years and every time it's served as a consistently great day out. I usually visit with people of all age ranges and it always goes down a treat, definitely visit!
Dubai world grand prix. We visit Meydan race course for Dubai world grand prix.Nice horses, fireworks, concert.... Worth it.
Celebrated not bday here. There was a race on Nov 7th in Medan and my sis in law gifted me Meydan race tickets. Had an excellent time there. Dinner was excellent.

World Cup Day. I visited here twice, once the day before fir what's called Breakfast with the Stars (the horses and jockeys) and the next day for race day.The race course is delightful, large, clean with attentive staff.We booked the tickets with open bar and food, it's slightly higher in price but worth it, lunch is either finger food or sit down hot buffet. Nice food too.The only very difficult thing is getting a cab back as many people are trying at the same time.

No atmosphere. There is no atmosphere as there is no betting. hard to get a taxi after the races. Food was good and facilities were good also but if you enjoy racing UK style this is not the place for you.
Amzing experience. It was an amazing experience to watch the race sipping your favourite drink. Would recommend and will go again on the next season.

Fun Times. Getting in and out is a pain, especially for big events like the Dubai World Cup. We were in the premium section, which had a great selection of food and drinks, but it was a bit crowded and there was definitely a lack of indoor seating.
The Best. Dubai has become such a great destination....places like meydan are just a must see for all those who visit
Good venue that lends itself to events. I have been here for live concerts as well as for the races. Meydan is a good venue with ample parking and organization.

Honeymoon. Me and my husband stayed in this hotel as part of our honeymoon in September 2015 before going on to Mauritius and we absolutely loved it. Everyone is so friendly and staff always recommending places to visit and make reservations if you don't have anything planned. On arrival we were given a welcome drink and a wet towel to cool down (which you will need). Everything is so extravagant from huge velvet chairs to massive chandeliers. There were hidden doors in your hotel room to store luggage and there are door bells rather than people knocking. The rooms were very modern with touch pads everywhere for lights and curtains in the bathroom. There was a tv (we think) in the bathroom above a huge bath but we were not sure how to work this. There was also a separate shower which was amazing. When we stayed it was not very busy and all of the staff remembered our names when we were walking around the hotel. We went in the pool on the roof which was an infinity pool with amazing views. Towels are provided and the waiter also handed out fruit while you were up there.We ate in the steak restaurant one evening and everything was delicious, we would definitely recommend.As we were on our honeymoon we had a lovely cake left for us in our room on arrival and also one presented in the steak restaurant for desert which was very nice. There are always taxi's outside and if you want one, the door man will pull one over for you.The hotel is slightly out of the way from the centre where all of the action is but it does not take long to get into the town and not that expensive.We really enjoyed our stay here any only have positive things to feed back. We would love to come again when the racing is on.
nice golf course. i play there is a really nice golf course , nice staff very helpful , there was no horse race , but i will be back for them .....

Not just a racecourse. A must visit. Good restaurant with great menu. We went to play golf on the Track course many times. Great course and price is not bad. always started with good coffee, a visit to the Pro shop , good golf and then brunch.

World Class. Visited the Meydan Racecourse because i was lodging at the Meydan hotel and i must say this is without one of the best horse race courses i have ever been to. the location and the facilities on ground is out of this world.

One of the most profitable races take place here. It's not a surprise to many that Dubai holds some of the most profitable races.The seasons are short due to the hot weather in Dubai, so go and join the frenetic scene if you have time.
Worlds Best Racecourse. Was there for Dubai World Cup 2016. It was my first time attending the World Cup. An amazing expereicne one have to visit Meydan if they are visiting Dubai.

Must do in Dubai. We went to last Dubai world cup and it was truly an incredible experience. We've never been to a horse race, and did not know if we liked it, but truly enjoyed ourselves. We only got the cheapest tickets (50dhs), but were a bit disappointed by the dining options that came along with it. Everybody can roam around freely in the whole area, but you are only allowed to access the restaurants dedicated to the ticket class you bought. Accordingly, we were stuck with the likes of Pizza Hut, which was not worth the occasion, but our bad. Next time I'd go for more expensive tickets to get the full experience, but if you don't plan to eat or drink there you might as well be fine with the general access.
Great facility …!. For the aficionados of horse racing, this is must place to visit. No gambling. Great atmosphere and extremely safe. A must visit during the Dubai World Cup.

Weird experience. I like the stadium as a whole.But i went there in its early days when it had recently opened. I attended a race. It was so chaotic and hot and sultry due to the weather. Elton John performed later that night in open air on a stage erected on part of the course. The sound was pretty bad, We couldnt hear much. We also couldnt find any place to eat either. I dont know, are you not supposed to be eating at the stadium? Maybe youré only allowed your drink in hand? I hope things have changed now. Plus the icing on this sticky night was the whole place was infested with british folk, most of them didn't seem to know jack about the game, they just want to wear their hats and coats and insta themselves living the life in dubai. it was a real putoff...

Amazing spectacle. Safe happy environment. We took a cab to the course (ask to be dropped at the entrance to the stand!). A great friendly, happy atmosphere. What a different no gambling, no drinking, makes. So different to the 'swim through' at a lot of Australian race meeting. We went to the first meeting of the season, free entry! Would love to be there for Dubai Cup season.We had plenty of time to catch our flight home after the racing ended.

Well organized and managed. The hotel around and the race circle all advanced built , also the management effort is a big witness of the place , the near by community developed very high end villas and palaces , adding that it's very close by design district , dubai mall , boulevard sheikh mohamed ,

great family day out. Wow !!! Firsly they hit you with this massive glass wall aquarium, with the most amazing ammount of fish of all types and sizes, then if ypu want to venture deeper and what an adventure sharks , massive king size alligators, too many to mention, when its done the dubai way its really special, it took us hours to get round , worth every penny.

End of year party. Absolutely Fabulous service and really accommodated our needs. Food was a lot better then expected and everyone had a fabulous time. I would recommend this for a staff party event as it was actually quite cheap per head for what we ate and drank.

HIGH CLASS ENVIRONMENT!. It has been existing to be in this place because you can enjoy the to select your horses during the presentation! People are very well dressed and elegant! The class at the nd of the day!

Meydan racecourse is stunning. I had a chance to participate in a 2 day conference at The Meydan hotel at the Racecourse and it was a great experience.The view is fantstic and on race days it is amazing.On the costly side but definitely an indulgence worth picking up.

Beautiful place for shows and concerts. I visited Meydan for a show and found it simply amazing. They have ample parking space and it is beautifully designed. They have a club, good restaurants to eat etc.
Dubai World Cup. What a place! Amazing day here, great racing & amazing fireworks in the evening. Plenty of seating, could do with more bathrooms, always a line for those.

The Dubai Gold Cup is growing in stature. Ascot was once a bit special, and maybe still is, but now perhaps only in the Royal Enclosure, the rest has sorted of descended into a rather large jolly up. Nothing wrong with that maybe and if it's for you, then great. The Meydan has the feel for me that Ascot did twenty years ago, and the weather is a lot more reliable. So it is well worth timing a visit to Dubai to take in the races, if you want to dress up and have some civilised fun watching the gg's. the Champagne is in abundance, as are the ladies in their hats. The tote may be absent, but in the age of smartphones and online gaming you won't be deprived of a flutter, just the feel of cash in your hands and the queue to get on before the start. Not sure I'll miss either here, as for me the cash only seemed to go one way at Ascot.

Dinner at Meydan Racecource. Superlative!! both in taste and location!! The view is amazing!! I didnt stay in this hotel as I thought it would be damn expensive! And Indeed it is. The structural layout here are an amazing testimony of what the power of money can achieve. It overlooks a lush looking racecource

Nice view from Meydan Hotel. I have an opportunity to stay at Meydan Racecourse Hotel in December. It's an amazing 5 star rate hotel which connected to racecourse where you can watch the racer train themselves every morning between 5~6am. Racecourse were a bite off shape & damage and it's was really a distance away to Emirate Mall with no other transport with only accessible with Taxi, limo or by car

A million dollar experience!. A party of eight of us went to the Dubai World Cup on Saturday 26th March. The whole day was incredible from the moment we left the car to the moment we took the shuttle bus back to the Dubai Mall to get a taxi. It was a privilege to attend the most prestigious event in the world and to people watch all the race-goers in their finery. The horse racing was very exciting as was the spectacular firework display we were treated to post races. Dubai certainly knows how to put on a show. It wasn't finished there though, mega star Janet Jackson provided the entertainment to finish the day with her Unbreakable Tour set. A day not to be missed. Thank you Meydan, it was fantastic.

A stunning race course. Beautiful race course with great views from the stadium and feels so much smaller that it really is as you get such good views. Also offers great restaurant choices with pretty good packages available
Opulent. There was no racing on the day of my visit but the course and the hotel are opulent and I can just imagine what it would be like on racing days. Well worth a visit.
And they're Off!!. Live entertainment after the races. Janet Jackson this year. Not the best racing in the world,my opinion,but the richest!! A real spectacular. Shame you can't have a bet

Breakfast with the Stars. The early start and long journey was well worth it. We were greeted by friendly staff (at 6am). The set up was lovely, and the breakfast choice was endless. The racing celebrities mixed with the fans and were happy to chat and take photos. My original thoughts were that it was an event that would be a one off, but we are already planning to go back next year.

World Cup 2016. Beautiful racetrack and facility. I would have loved to take a tour but none were scheduled the weekend of the World Cup. We sat in the Gallery section and were very pleased with the seating. We were just past the finish line and high enough to have an excellent view of the race. The Gallery area was not crowded and seats are not assigned so there is ample opportunity to sit in different locations as well as access to the rail for closer viewing. The Gallery package also allows entrance to the Parade and Apron areas. We enjoyed the food buffet and drinks as part of the Gallery ticket package. The buffet and dining tables are indoors, easily accessed and well laid out. I didn't feel rushed and crowded as is the atmosphere at the Kentucky Derby. We had a wonderful day at Meydan which was perfected by a CA Chrome win. Beautiful fireworks after the race and Janet Jackson performed in the Apron area after the fireworks. We took the free shuttle from the track back to the Dubai Mall after the concert.

Fantastic Day at the World Cup Race Meeting. We had tickets for The Gallery for our first visit to the Dubai Worl Cup and were were not disappointed in the slightest, in fact we had an amazing day - all the food you could eat, as much drink as we could handle, fantastic evening's racing, fireworks, Janet Jackson pop concert made for one great experience. upon arrival we were immediately escorted by golf buggies to our hospitality area where you walk the red carpet to enter - you get free bets to win large cash prizes, and plenty of seating and space so never felt that busy or uncomfortable. Despite it being a hot day the stands are well positioned so the sun is behind them and all indoor areas well air conditioned. If really wanted to go town there were competitions for best dressed lady, couple and best hat, so plenty of great fashion on view and these offered some fantastic prize packages

Fantastic day out even though I am not interested in horse racing.. What a place to visit. Was worth every penny and the place is so big and everything is so well organised. Must visit. The race course looks spectacular and the atmosphere is out of this world. Be care as the drinks inside the race course are very expensive to say the least. The fireworks display is something not to be missed.
fantastic. this was our 4th visit to the dubai world cup at meydan , love it every year , great course looking forward to going again next year
dubai world cup racing2016. What an amazing experience you have to do it to believe it fantastic atmosphere and extremely well organised

World Cup Day Meydan. The ultimate racing day at Meydan. Paid 1500 dhs (250 quid) which included entrance into terraces with outside seating, excellent view of trackside and finish line. Food and drink included all day, just had to pay extra for champagne. Good choice of food and drinks. Indoor restaurant area. Lots of races to watch, amazing fireworks and concert for closing ceremony. Definetely need to do this at least once.
Amazing Racecourse. A one of a kind racecourse! Truly unique! Visited for the Dubai World Cup and must say the event was very professionally planned.

Amazing and super Excitement. Visited Dubai in Feb and a friend invited me for dinner to Meydan , was super thrilled to see the course in flood lights and night races. track is lush green and so the paddock . Had super fun with delicious food.
horse racing!!. Meydan racecourse is the home of Dubai World Cup, the most coveted horse race in the world. Been to a few and enjoyed it to the most. Glamour all around u. excellent!!

Excellent. Oh wow is this the best horse racing stadium in the world at the moment . This is an incredible venue from the hospitality to the race track . Went to see the Dubai World Cup last week and was a fantastic day . We had the premium hospitality suite the food and drink was ever flowing with all sorts of food and any drink you wanted . The seats were very comfortable for 8 hours and nicely protected from the sun by the thoughtful overhang if the roof . Very cleaver . Would recommend the experience to anybody even if your not interested in horse racing .

Lovely base for a holiday in Dubai. My husband and I spent 5 nights at the Meydan on our first trip to Dubai. The setting of the hotel is wonderful surrounded by well manicured gardens and the race course looks amazing. We stayed in a room on the 8th floor which was huge, tastefully decorated and immaculate. Our room (looks like most if not all of the rooms) had a balcony which overlooked the racecourse. It was great to see the horses being trained first thing in the morning.Breakfast was a typical buffet style with continental breakfast and cooked breakfast being offered everyday served in Farriers Restaurant. Tables were offered inside and outside with views over the racecourse. We found eating earlier was better as the restaurant was better as the restaurant got quite busy and tables weren't always as clean as they could have been. A couple of times we asked for coffees which didn't arrive although we didn't chase them either. When you arrive for breakfast you are shown to a table which is great but then relies on the staff chasing you, sometimes as you leave to get your room number. The process could be streamlined so easily if you had to give your room number before being seated.The pool area was lovely located on the top of the hotel with views over the racecourse and out to the City. We found it to be really peaceful and quiet with staff to bring out towels and a drinks service too. Prices were about what we'd expected with alcoholic cocktails c. £9 and Non-alcoholic cocktails about £6.The hotel is a 20-30 minute drive away from the City and there is a shuttle provided although we used taxis. Taxis were readily available from the front of the hotel and ranged from £12-£18, averaging around £15.Room service was very tasty, reasonably priced with quick service. We ate in Shiba which was serving Chinese and Japanese food the night we went. Again, the service was excellent and the food was very good although we did think £90 for two starters, two mains, one side and two cocktails was a bit pricey. We had an amazing five nights at the Meydan and would recommend this hotel. Although out of the city centre the hotel was peaceful with great views of the Dubai city skyline. Would have been a 5 star review but for the haphazard breakfast process.

Not what was expected. Whilst the horses racing is the richest prize money in the world, the grandstand and the atrium incredibly impressinve the rest is of a very poor standard, unkesss you are lucky enough to be a guest in a private suite . The public equivalent to the Royal Enclosure is sadly lacking. Buffet food to be eaten off very flimsy plastic plates, plastic cutlery and glasses. No allocated seating in the premium area restaurant which was the standard of a rather lower class cafeteria. No screens to watch the action on the racecourse and no windows. Allocated seating was the only plus. The dress code is certainly not adhered to.There is little or no atmosphere in the grand stand due to no betting which is sort of understandable.A bitter disappointment all round. We are lucky enough to be members of British racecourses where the hospitality and service is terrific, despite the weather.I would strongly recommend saving your money and not going as is an expensive evening for not a lot.

Dubai World Cup 2016. The Dubai World Cup is an annual affair since 1996 and is a real carnival held on the last Saturday in March.We were a large group of friends availing of corporate hospitality courtesy of Meydan and had an excellent view of proceedings from our Suite 305.Free flowing food and beverage and a wonderful mix of races, light and sound displays, concluding with the final race for the evening which is the Dubai World Cup - the richest race in the world.Janet Jackson came on stage at the end for a concert but the acoustics were not too good so we left well before the concert concluded.Overall a lovely evening at a world class racing venue.

Dubai World Cup Absolutely Fantastic. We were in Dubai for a few days and coincidently the Dubai World Cup Races were on that Saturday. I have to tell you this is one amazing Racecourse!!!. It was a nightmare getting into it as we took a taxi and then had to drove around loops for ages and then got dropped off in open spaces to take a bus into the place. Anyway after that we had to get scanned like in airports except shoes belts everything came off. Security was tight.Once we got into the Apron Views Area which is where we bought out tickets for ( great value at $170AUD) and where all expats go. The track was amazing, the grandstand just out of this world. To watch some of the richest horse races in the world at this place was definitely one thing to do, would love to come here again. Bring plenty of money as the drinks and food are pricey compared to prices in Australia.

A DAY AT THE DUBAI RACES. I thought it was so facinating unlike in Australia in dubai we just chose the horses and if they come in the order they pay us we did not have to pay to bet in. and they bring the food to u while ur watching the racss.

Impressive. We dressed up for the occasion, although it is not necessary. Unbelievably huge. Can get a drink although expensive but cannot place a bet. All the big screens show the horses, trainers etc. but because there is no betting you do not have any odds to follow or know who is likely favourite. Well worth a visit. We paid £20 for entry in front of the paddock and just short of the finishing post, good spot and that includes a free drink.
Wow experience. Really enjoyed watching the race.Very clean and well managed place.Real entertainment.Will recommend to all race lovers.

What an amazing racecourse. We went to the Super Saturday race meeting and had a fabulous time. We bought our tickets for the premier seating area on line and picked them up at the ticket office on the day. (At 50 AED each it worked out at less than 10 pounds per ticket)The seating area was perfectly placed in line with the finishing post.This is an amazing venue and the racing was top class.If you are a gambler you need to be aware that there is no betting allowed on the racecourse

A must!!!. Great experience. Great ambiance. You can go for free or paying from 50 aeds. We paid and enjoyed. Good fast food and drinks. It's a great evening from oct to mar to go in family or with friends. It's really a must go!!!

Buffet brunch is amazing. We went for the buffet brunch as well as to enjoy the racing. Never been to a horse racing event before and was pleasantly surprised. The food was great and you could eat and drink all you wanted. Including lobster, oysters, crab and a myriad other choices. When you enter you get a free race card to see if you can predict the winners etc, no betting but this does allow you to win money if you forecast the right results. It makes the day more fun and good for the family too. They have supervised kids area with games and face painting, live band while you eat and it all adds up to an entertaining day out.

Great! Simply Spectacular!. My family and I went to the Meydan Racecourse over two days - the first on the 3rd March and the second on the 5th March. On our first visit we were escorted to the winners enclosures where we were able to see the races for that evening in luxurious setting; dinner served that evening was a five-course meal - the service was very good and the advice gained regarding the horses was useful.On the 5th March we went to the Promanade Parade Section where we learnt more - the atmosphere was fantastic and it was great fun choosing the horse one thought would win! All in all a fantastic two days at the Meydan Racecourse! The area is massive and there is plenty of room for everyone - truly a great attraction.
Great facility. Like horse racing should be. A beautiful place. No gambling like in the States though. Great grounds and sights.

Amazing place. So this place is quite far out and but you sort of see it rising out and the building looks spectacular. I am not a horse lover so I don't have a natural affinity to this place. The races were in the evening so it was very cool. The place is gigantic so one can really walk anywhere. It was really an elegant night out. There is no gambling here. Having said that when we came it wasn't too crowded so I couldn't really feel the intensity of the competition.

A must for a horse lovers. Not being a great fan of horses, we went out both for the stables tour as well as the Championship Races. Meydan is huge and the horses are taken care of in an unimaginable manner. No smell, super clean, you know who is the star there. For any horse lover a must visit attraction in Dubai. And the races are for free.

Great evening out!. We went to a Thursday evening meeting, we went in the public area - free to get in. At the gate you are given 2 cards; 1 is like a raffle ticket - you put your name and phone number and the winner gets a cash prize, the 2nd is a free betting slip to select 6 winners, again cash prizes for successful punters! A local guy helped us fill in our cards, it was great fun! We could get down to the paddock and next to the track, so great view of the racing. We were thrilled to see the famous American superstar California Chrome having a prep run before the World Cup later in March - of course he won, he got a huge cheer!

Fantastic racecourse . We booked the Winners Parade restaurant and the views are great. You can see the horses in the parade ring and most of course. The large screens can easily be seen. We went twice and the service was better the first time than the second. However, the food was very good and the staff were very pleasant. The only negatives were the air con was too high and it got very cold inside, the second problem to watch out for is the pillars. The two times they tried to put us behind pillars, but they did respond to my wife's complaints and found better tables. The only other thing to be aware of is the glass panels above the first tier can block your vision, so ask for a table on the lower tier. The dinner ticket does allow you to go to the parade ring also and if you ask the waiter will show you the way.

Superb again.....Silks. This is the 4th time over the last 3 years we have been racing and spent the evening in Silks. There is a wide selection of food at the buffet and the drinks are free flowing. The staff are great and our waiter for the evening was outstanding, Prasanna was always on hand to top up drinks , clear the plates etc , he goes about his work with a cheery attitude and smile , which can only enhance your evening . The racing was great too.

Highlight of our trip. We went to the first night of the Dubai World Cup Carnival. We chose one of the dining packages so had a wonderful view of the horse arena and winning post. Our meal was delicious and the service outstanding. We had a wonderful night and loved the whole atmosphere (even though we found the no gambling very odd) definitely worth a visiting.

Beautiful track. Came here not knowing what to expect, We were fortunate enough to be in a luxury box with friends. The views were outstanding and food amazing, This was a fantastic night out. The excitement and quality of track and stadium incredible.

An evening at the races. This is an amazing racecourse, very similar in design to the new Ascot grandstand. Extremely good for viewing with the large screens watching the racing.(no need to take binoculars). Would recommend the premium enclosure(approx £10) where you have your own seat with an at seat service for food and alcohol(or you can fetch your own). Very colourful race cards are provided free of charge together with pool betting(similar to tote jackpot) for which the pot is provided by the racecourse authorities

Great night's racing. We made a return visit to Meydan for the Dubai Carnival races and booked a table at the Winner's Circle restaurant. Food was high quality and plentiful and there were unlimited alcoholic drinks available. Great views of the racecourse and the parade ring.

Silks restaurant package. We have visited many racecourses in the UK and other parts of the world - this is the best.Food is superb and service even better.Free WiFi so if prepared in advance you can place your bets during the evening if you need to. Did mine in advance so could fully enjoy the evening.Take a taxi to and from the racecourse - not expensive from the Dubai Mall or Business Bay (Best) Metro -30DM £6 Each way.Even saw the might Crome win - good luck for Gold cup night !Hope to visit again soon

Amazing...and a bit strange. I love the races so really wanted to see what it was like in Dubai. Facilities, horses ,jockeys all top class. Very reasonable to get in - there is a free area but only 50 dhs to get in the premier enclosure by the finishing line. I went on a Thursday night and it was quite quiet and lacked a bit of 'buzz'. No betting but there was a pick 6 type game with prizes . Staff at the course were very attentive and helpful. Alcohol is served in the premier enclosure but expensive 45dhs for a beer. A good evening out !

Beautiful Experience. Each visit is a beautiful experience..Great staff! Well managed service!!And great dining menus!!Visited the World Cup Carnival races last weekend and was a great experience.Looking forward to the World Cup Races

Great Brunch Buffet. Went for brunch with the girls here. I don't like horse racing particularly but there are no jumps here so I made an exception. The choice of food at the buffet was huge. The service was very very good and the place was full to the rafters. There is a play area for children with a ball pond and face painting keeping them amused while their parents enjoyed their day. No gambling allowed naturally but you do receive a race guide and it's fun to pick out your winners. I'm not sure if you would have access to an online account with a betting site. Car park is quite sprawling and I found the signage confusing. That's a small downside to a great day.

Nice Day Out. The facilities are all good and the grandstand itself is very smart and luxurious in parts. The race meets are well organised and there are a decent selection of options for meals and packages. The racing can be clearly seen on the screens but the track is well positioned so that most of the races can be seen from the stands anyway. Would go again
Thursday evening race evening. What a fantastic set up and location. No betting. Dubai love their facing and they do it in style. It is a great evening out. Plenty of places to eat and drink.

Good night out. Free entry on the night we visited. Great for families, loads of people there with kids, eating picnics, running around etc. Fab atmosphere and an amazing racecourse. Nothing like it in the UK.

Superb nights racing . This was god second time that we visited Meydan. We booked a table in the winners circle which was a four course meal with drinks package. The food was lovely, the view from our table was fantastic and the whole evening was amazing... We even had 3 winners!!The facility is the best racecourse I have ever been to and is a must for race goers. The photo is the view from our table

Interesting night at the races. We spent an evening here enjoying the races - sadly no winners for me but enjoyable all the same. Very strange without all the bookies taking bets but racing was still well attended by young and old. As expected the race track and the stands were immaculate. The stands are very grand and you could easily get lost. Food and wine was reasonable and it was great to see all the different cultures enjoying watching the races. Worth a night time visit given it's reasonable entry fee.

International Sporting heritage in the UAE. If you want to see magnificent horses of international and Arabian descent this is the place to go for world class racing. Beautiful hippodrome and pageantry. The Emirati and its large ex-pat community together attend events here and the love of horses is evident as the love of these thrilling races.A fun early morning stop on your visit to Dubai.
Great experience. Try the brunch at The Terrace overlooking the race course. It's a great way to enjoy an entertaining day out!

Fantastic evening at Silks, recommended. Fantastic evening at Silks Restaurant here. My 2nd time coming but this time with family. Drinks were never empty, food was excellent, racing was well explained even for novices.
Will definitely be back
Hotel was excellent. Great hotel, excellent service and ideal for a night stay. We had a great view of the racecourse and breakfast was excellent. Recommended for couples, families and even oldies :)

Lovely racecourse in Dubai. This is a lovely racecourse. We want there for the Friday Brunch. An amazing array of foods from all over the world. Sitting overlooking the racecourse it was a great day out. I would love to go to the actual races there. Camels, horses etc

Southwell By The Sand. Almost impossible to get to by public transport and even worse getting back. It might be free to enter but everything else is expensive. In reality, a lot of the horses did not appear to be that classy - There are a few British exports who used to be good but are now past it and certainly won't be going to stud. The "breakfast and stable visit" had all the signs of being a massive rip-off. $150 or so for a buffet breakfast and a tour of the track's expensive restaurants, some stables and the weighing room. At Epsom this used to be $5 and you'd get a certificate to show that you had weighed in (at a completely fictional weight)

Awesome . We visited Nad al Sheba 7 years ago while Meydan was being built. It was a terrific racing experience then but tonight at Meydan was in a different class again. The race course is just awesome. As avid race goers in the UK we've been to most tracks, including Royal Ascot and Epsom Derby many times. Meydan is something special again, even on a modest weekly race night.

A wonderful evening with amazing hospitality.. We pre booked our evening at the races prior to flying out for our holiday in Dubai very easily on the Meydan website.We booked in the Winners circle restaurant for an inclusive package of food and drink.First race was at 7pm and drinks were served from 6.30pm Word of warning a 20 min taxi ride at this time of night takes over an hour so we were a little bit rushed but our fault!Shown to our table excellent view wall to ceiling glass over the winners circle (obviously!!) and the winning post you cannot fail to be impressed the champagne arrived and then we relaxed and started to enjoy the evening. We were served by a young man named 'Robin' from India who was studying hospitality and doing his placement at the Meydan Winners circle Restaurant, he was an amazing young man who will go far in his chosen career I hope they recognise this at the Meydan and give him a job!!The food choice, wine and drinks package was of a very high standard and for anybody that likes the races this is an experience not to be missed.The icing on the cake was seeing Sheikh Mohammed Bin Rashid and his entourage (there was plenty of them) enjoying the races and the horses from the Godolphin stables.We loved Dubai and this was our favourite evening out, if you get the chance you wont be disappointed.
Exciting Place. great place for watching exciting horse races during the 20th anniversay celebration of the Dubai Worl Cup

amazing. For once the racing was on during our trip to Dubai so we decided to go. We went to the Silks restaurant which offered a buffet meal and a balcony overlooking the winning straight. The staff were very attentive without being obtrusive and the food was lovely. Great experience, really enjoyed it.Would advise getting a taxi to it, took us approx 30 minutes from Dubai Marina and cost approx 75 to 80 AED.

Great Nights Racing. Had a great nights racing, well worth a visit. We entered the general admission area which was free, you also get free betting on six races with good prize money if you're fortunate to pick the winners.

New Attractions planned near Meydan. There is a whole new attraction venue planned near / next to Meydan. There should be a whole new 3D / 4D type of venue place in the making in the next few years that shall include light shows, fashion shows, sports events and be the trend setting venue place in the whole Middle East. Discussions are under way. Watch this spot.

Great . What a fabulous racecourse!
I can see why the industry loves to race at Meydan and the polo exhibitions are first class.
Great facilities. Everything feels luxurious and splendid
Hard not to feel the vip service here.
Superb Dubai!

Beautiful Racecourse. We did the winners circle restaurant with set menu and drinks. Service and food were great. Our hotel booked the tickets for us and it was really easy to pick them up at the track. However, if you want to gamble you have to do it with your own group as there is no tote or bookmakers.

Unbelivevable site. Fantastic evening of racing. We had a meal in the Grandstand which was great, it included drinks in the price. Views from the grandstand are fantastic. Strange to go racing and not bet, but still a great memory.
Supeb Race course. Famus place for world racers. Once a year here we have Special meydan race events too. All arround the peoples coming thee

love horses? love a bit of betting? love drinks and networking?. Then this is the spot for you, your friends and then some. Lots of entertainment through out the day and night! Got to try out Club WHITE

A must visit for race goers. My daughter and I had a wonderful visit to this fabulous race course, The Winner's Circle Restaurant was very comfortable, food delicious,all staff couldn't be more attentive and helpful, the view, parade ring,winner's enclosure and TV screens made this a truly memorable visit.So why only the 4 rating?We have the best Stall Handlers in the World, and this visit confirmedthis for me.

Must be visited in Dubai. I had visited Meydan at the openning of annual horse races, we were there with big team of freand and we really liked it. Good view from the restaurant, food is very good. Service is not perfect, but it is a small thing comparing to beautiful horses you may see thtough the windows.

class. We decided to take the early morning stable tour starting with breakfast at Meydan Hotel a delightful experience. Then on to stable tour with an experienced guide and driver. What a nice time met the farrier saw the horses being shod & were given a horseshoe each. Watched horses on gallops & exercising in hydro pool. we were allowed to visit jockeys room, some place. On to winners circle then shop and told about various resturants and hospitality deals. A super visit

A nice change. We went to Winners Circle with a group of friends and really enjoyed it. The 4 course meal was great quality fine dining and the drinks kept flowing from the attentive staff.It's good to try it, I'd recommend it.

The place to go BEFORE the World Cup Carnival.. By visiting Meydan on Thursday evening BEFORE the World Cup, you can enjoy a delicious meal and a 7 race card for the cost of a brunch an without all the hassle of too many other racegoers! 5 course dinner with selected drinks is a real bargain and a fabulous night with quality food and great service in Tiers restaurant. Back again for our 4th consecutive visit this week!
World cup!. Dubai world cup is one of the finest nights in Dubai you should make it a "must do". Amazing food, awesome entertainment.
A Night to Remember. I am not a normal visitor to any Racecourse but the facilities at Meydan have to be seen to be believed. They are outstanding.
Great Day. Being horse racing lovers we had to visit Meydan for New Year Racing - we booked the Winners Circle restaurant and it certainly was a treat - would highly recommend it

Racing Dubai. I have been racing at Meydan a number of times and have, most often, eaten in Silks restaurant which is buffet style and caters for the whole family.If you are going and are interested in the racing make sure when you book that you get a table with a window view so that you can eat and watch the racing.

Relaxing evening at the races. We bought the Premium Seating at 50 Dh per person, which gives a lot more space but the Grandstand seating is also a lot of fun and interesting. One key to remember, arrive to the races at least one hour before the first race so that you have time to participate in the various race picking, gambling is illegal so you need to participate in a full contest and prizes awarded on that basis. Otherwise get on some off track betting site and bet online....Beautiful course, lots of parking, great facilities, very relaxing, have fun!

delightful evening. Meydan was a great night out. We were expecting crowds like you see on TV, but we felt like we had the place to ourselves.Tickets for “The Premium” were 50 Dirham, and allow you to go up really close to the parade ring and near the rail by the finish line. There’s a free section as well, which looked like a lot of fun (but is not by the finish line). Beer and wine is not available in the free section, but is for sale in the other sections.The best part was the atmosphere. Although it looks all glitzy, it’s really friendly, like a small-town racetrack. For example, when a young girl asked one of the winning jockeys for a souvenir, he smiled and tossed her his goggles.Also, are great views of the Dubai skyline from the desert side.Would totally recommend this for both visitors and residents.

Race day at winners circle restaurant. To start with the good... the food was good quality and somewhat innovative so well done to the chefs other than the selection of cheeses for the dessert option. It was a shame the waiting staff let you down, service abymissmally slow from the drinks waiters and food waiters (maybe) the level of English understanding of the waiting staff which was well below par for such a venue was a contributing factor, but the maitre'd was not organising and directing staff efficently. We were one of many tables complaining (and to be frank I don't complain unless it is REALLY bad). The reason it gets an average was saved by the quality of the food otherwise maybe NO stars

Dubai Racecourse - Wow. Amazing, we took a tour through our hotel, it was an early start 7.30am arranged our own transport, taxi to the hotel, had a fab breakfast and watched the horses training with the sun coming up. at 8.15 we were taken to the stables where we saw the horses being bathed, trained, on the treadmill, swimming pools, went back to the hotel and were shown around the suites where you can pay to watch the racing and all the different packages were explained to us, if we were to go to Dubai again to watch a race, the next one now is March the huge race. Saw the jockey room, fitness room, shown Frankie Datoris saddles - it was a fab morning out, finished at 11.45. defo recommend and would do again.
the best place to catch a race. meydan racecourse is still the place to go for a camel race..packed on weekends its also a good place to meet other high society socialites

True horseman experience. Magnificent state of the art race track impeccably designed and maintained. Manicured grounds and beautifully landscape for spectacular racing.mno betting allowed so the purist racing enthusiastic fans will enjoy it the most as well as conissorers of beauty and architecture landscape.

Breakfast and Stable Tour. Breakfast at the hotel overlooking the race course was superb and the tour of stables and other facilities excellent. Our guide was excellent, but the management had made him into a walking billboard by introducing each restaurant and bar as we went round.

Meyadn Stable Tour: Behind the Scenes at the Races. Far more than expected, this is a great way to spend a morning in Dubai. The breakfast buffet at the Meydan Hotel was a sumptuous beginning, followed by an extended and informative tour of the stables and grandstand. The guide has been in horse racing most of his life and in the UAE since the early 90s, a veritable walking history book of Dubai racing and breeding. While in the stables guests can interact with horses, in addition to seeing them fed, washed, shod, run, and taken for a swim. The grandstand tour started to get a bit tedious as it was obviously part marketing, selling box and restaurant reservations. Otherwise, great value for money. Go do it.
Saw a long time ago..was quite nice. I plan on going back next time I visit Dubai. Great to see how the racing industry is in other countries .

world class racecourse....... I visited the racecourse with my friends....Before reaching the spot,it was a thrilling excitment for all of us. Whatever is constructed in Dubai ,that would be world class which is usually the policy I believe.We parked our car outide the stadium. There is 5 star hotel attached in the Racecourse stadium.Wow......We watched the race from the top of the 5 star hotel. Fantastic The race track was very beautifully formed with lush green grass. It was a treat to our eyes.I strongly recommend this place to be visited in Duabi. Congratulations to the Dubai Government for having constructed a marvellous race course......

Another world of beauty!!!!. All the arrangements make the place amazing! You walk in - you are greeted, escorted, accommodated... what else you need? ... Horse races? ... They are just amazing ... I had a premium ticket cost 50 AED, if you are interested in the races then it is for you as the other options are more focused on food and beverages. The atmosphere is very nice feels like the atrium is alive... Dont miss the next races guys! A glass of beer, cool weather(take some jackets its cold in winter) and new friends...

What a view from Meydan Hotel. A very well kept racecourse, offers a great view from Meydan Hotel. Lush green tracks, the racecourse has maintenance teams working every morning. The riders emerge early morning to train. Overall the racecourse looks scenic.

Wonderful experience. Booked a corporate suite for fourteen of us, very reasonably priced for four hours of fabulous food and drink in your suite with adjoining viewing balcony to watch the horse racing. This is a great night out!.

Went for Brunch with friends. Weird location given that there was nothing going on apart from the luch, but selection of food, like at most brunches in Dubai, was fantastic.Kids well looked after and plenty of drinks to wash it all down with.May choose somewhere else next time though as it is a little isolated and a bit far from downtown.

Evening at the races. Book an evening for the first race night of the season book table in the winner'scorch restaurant it was waiters service the four course meal was excellent and endless drinks good view of the races looking over the finish line did not have to more from our table we had a good view of ever thing
Impressive. Hug place , you will feel it only when you attending white sensation festival which hosting there every year in October Don't miss next year

Great Night Out. We went racing to Meydan with friends who live in Dubai for an evening meeting in December also booking to also have dinner in the Winner's Circle restaurant.The views from our table, looking out across the final straight towards the winning post, was excellent - they also have several huge screen directly in front of you for when the horses are on the other side of the course. Its was a large restaurant but all the tables are banked so that no matter where you sit the views are completely unimpeded. You pay a fixed price for four courses but you could choose your starters and main courses and the price also includes all drinks (which included spirits and several choices of white, red & rose wine).In my experience, when catering for large numbers the food tends not to be the best but I was happily proved wrong as our meal was excellent and served very hot.Your ticket also allows you to wander down to the parade ring and access most of the outdoor areas and its well worthwhile popping down to soak up the atmosphere for at least one race as well as to take in the sheer size of the grandstand which is just huge.We saw six races and whilst it's slightly odd (for us anyway !) that you are unable to gamble we had a fantastic evening and hope to return one day.

Meydan Stable Tour. Offered by the Meydan hotel, this tour gives you the chance for a 'behind the scenes' glimpse of the stables and the racecourse facilities. This is a must for anyone who loves horses and/or racing.The morning starts early at 7.30 for breakfast in the Meydan Hotel, was somewhat disappointed with the standard of food here, not what I would expect for a 5 star hotel.After that, its onwards to the stables to meet the beautiful horses and to see a bit of their morning routine. You can get up close to the horses for a pet which is wonderful. It would have been nice, however, to learn a bit more about them, which bloodlines they come from, their race history etc. I would say, more time should have been spent in this part to learn all of this.After that, you get taken to the racecourse and you can go onto the turf and visit the jockey's room and see the facilities there. You also get shown the restaurants and facilities indoor for if you were to visit a race (perhaps a little too much time spent doing this part).All in all a thoroughly enjoyable visit, more information on the horses (as well as time spent) from the tour guide would have been nice.

World Class Racing. We went for the Dubai World Cup in March, what a day. Superb racing in superb surroundings. Had gallery tickets which included food and drink. He night ended with kylie minogue on stage. What a day !

Hospitality night. A really great value for money evening which would cost you 5 Times this amount at Ascot.Great views over the course with very attentive staff. Although they are a bit green early in the season. Perhaps need a few more run outs?If you are in a group of 4 or more it is fine, but if only 2 or 3 of you, you can hear the next tables easily and listening to expat bores, is not really my idea of entertainment....Even if you are not a racing fan , it is good fun.I would recommend that you pre book your return taxi though as that can be a hassle at the end of a good evening.Very good food for a corporate type environment.

Amazing racecourse, great facilities for the horses and humans!!. Views from the Meydan Hotel balcony are spectacular, the racecourse is just superb. the horses have every amenity. If you are lucky enough to have a view from the sky bubble you will be rewarded when you watch a race

Must visit for the Dubai World Cup. I attended the Dubai World Cup 2015 and it was a superb experience. It was my first time visiting this racetrack and it is a solid piece of artwork...very well designed and constructed. Service at Meydan is top notch like at most places in Dubai. The atmosphere was surreal and fun...I definitely recommend ppl check this place out for weekly races during race season or for the biggest event, the Dubai World Cup :)

Dissappointing . After an amazing experience last season we were very disappointed when we visited as a group for the first race meet of the season.The venue remains stunning however the service at the Winners Circle last evening was not what we expected.We booked three tables for the 4 course meal and drinks offer expecting a repeat of the fantastic experience we had had as a smaller group last year. Arriving promptly at 6.30 as requested we filled in our race cards and asked for them to be collected. When someone finally collected them we were told it was too late. Our starters were not served until 8.45 and then our mains arrived after the final race. Then staff obviously in a hurry to clear us out served desert while mains still on the table.Having paid 475aed each for this experience we were all dissapointed with how our meals were served.Having recommended this venue to the others I was embarrassed. Such a shame.
Great Venue . Went here for an event 30 thousands people partying and drinking Dubai is a good night out. Also a great view from the hotel.

Amazing race course and fabulous tour.. Booked a tour at the course as my daughters have a big interest in horses and I must say we were all thoroughly impressed with the course, the stables, the informative tour and the great breakfast in the Meydan hotel.We were met by our guide Mark who looked after us all morning, Mark gave us so much information and delivered with an obvious passion, the stables and horses within were immaculate and the actual course stands were something else, the behind the scenes stuff was fab too. all in all this is a wonderful tour and not just for enthusiasts of racing or horses, all my family found it most interesting and fun. I would have no hesitation in recommending this tour, great value for money too. Hats off to Mark who looked after us, a thoroughly nice chap...
Bigger and Better than Pune of India. I have never seen a race course like this in India. Three parellar ways to horse racing. Do visit on Friday for race.
Lovely Views. We booked a hospitality dinner & drinks for a special occasion & could not fault anything, food & drinks very good & service was excellent, lovely setting with views over racecourse
Experience. Amazing place to go to visit,even if there is no racing on it is well worth the effort to see..there are fantastic restaurant's at the track beautiful .setting..

Fun in the sun. Had the opportunity to go to the world cup here in Dubai, and it was a very good race day however just remember you can not place a bet at the race course. it was very expensive to get in about £80 however it is Dubai. the drink and food was very good inside and the atmosphere unreal,

See The Dubai World Cup at Meydan Racecourse.. We visit Meydan for The Dubai World Cup Horse Racing. An excellent venue to enjoy the races! Something for everyone from Hospitality to basic Apron viewing.
At the Dubai World Cup. Amazing race course, hosts world's richest horse race.Very lively, well-dressed crowd. Wide variety of refreshments.
Nice racecourse. nice racecourse, we have seen it when it was prepped for the upcoming races. It looks really good and big.
Must visit place. I have gone there many times and the Meydan hotel has some amazing and best restaurants wit the amazing backdrop of race course, a must go place
Spectacular world cup. Have been to Meydan several times now for the Dubai World Cup. The venue is spectacular and the race day s buzzing and full of fantastic atmosphere. Try it.

First class dining and entertainment. This sporting attraction is typical for Dubai. Food and restaurants are very good at all levels. Children are welcome and the food selection caters for all tastes. Various beverage options are available. Excellent service.

5 Star horse racing course. Its an amazing place to visit during Dubai Racing season. You can also visit it in the morning and see the horses in training. Its a massive green space, and unique architecture. seeing it from far away will never convince you that this is a racing track.
Amazing place, especially for Horse lovers. I go every Thursday, always looking forward to be there , ready for the races. The racecourse is majestic.

Superb horse racing course but without the official betting. Meydan is the home of the Dubai World Cup, the richest racing meeting in the world hosting some 70k audience in a big Ascot style with pomp and circumstance and high totty factor. Race season normally starts end Oct / beginning of Nov where I would recommend going for good value of money entertainment to either the buffet style hospitality open for all or the table service Tiered Restaurant for set menu. Go with a big group so that you can do your own self-arranged betting as normal betting is not allowed in UAE (and also blocked over internet).

Fun and unusual experience. We visited the race course with friends for one of the most prestigious horseraces and been lucky to stay in one of the sponsors lounges. Wow what an amazing experience it had been joining such event for the very first time. I highly recommend to it to everyone who seeks to experience something new. Great organization, clean facilities, fantastic atmosphere...stayed the whole day. Also went back to Meydan for a life concert of Lady Gaga. Again great organization, spacious and superb music environment. Just make sure you remember well were you had parked your car...endless parking decks.
amazing dubai. Amazing experience good to go with lots of old friend in Dubai.best experience I have ever had.thanks Kim for letting us know.

Great day for the races... Exciting place to be, and to watch the races. I used to go race tracks in the USA, and enjoy an afternoon of races. This place is nicer and newer, with great ambiance. I highly recommend it, especially on a nice Friday afternoon.

Meydan Racecourse. You have to check out a race while in Dubai. This racetrack is so grand and a must see. During the off season it's very quiet but if you are with a good group of friends it will be a fun night.
This is how you do horse racing. Make sure you plan ahead and that there's an event or race taking place before you set off on your visit.

External visit no race . Our friends live right by here and took us to give us an idea of its sheer size.They've invited us to come back next year and take part in the Dubai gold cup. I'm very tempted. You can just tell it must be the racing event of the year and the dress code would be dress to impress.It's clean, modern and very lush. I think we will be definitely back!

World Cup Review - a bit late !. Went to the World Cup meeting earlier this year - one of the 'must do' events on the Dubai Calendar. We had an all inclusive package near the finish line.The whole day was very good - just a shame that the big screen by the finish line was not used to show the Kylie concert after the racing as this would have made the experience better. The food, drinks and atmosphere were all excellent.

Another thing to do while in Dubai. Apart from the World Cup, there are smaller horse races between Nov-Mar. Great social activity to do if you are in Dubai - dress up, have a bubbly, watch the race, talk to people. Good fun!
class apart. a place of sports and sophistication ! its a v classy place for a bright sunday! u can bet and play and enjoy dubai

Fabulous Dubai Worl Cup, best horse racing in the work in the best venue by far.. Visited this venue for the Dubai World Cup, it's wonderful. Buy the best tickets that you can afford, we had premium (by the finish line) they were amazing, you can see everything you need to see and more, plus free food and drink ALL day! Preferable than a hospitality view which is a little disconnected to the racing I feel. Book you return car journey!!!

A Tourist Must during the Race Season. Race Nights in the Warm Evenings of Dubai are a great way to enjoy one of the best Race Scenes in the World. Even the lead up races for the Dubai World Cup are entertaining and a great way to spend an evening with friends.
Dubai World Cup. Enjoyed a fun filled day at the races watching the Dubai world cup, and then entertained by 'Kylie' for the aftershow party.Yes its expensive, but everything is Dubai is!

Collections of Horse Through bred.. The richest World Cup is Dubai World Cup for Horse Racing.. the passionate of Horse lovers can be visit this place Meydan, connected with HIFI five Star Hotel Meydan Hotel. Early morning people can reach and visit the stable house, horse training, practice and etc.. The Race happens on last week of all the time but you can can book and check the availability by calling Dubai Equestrian Club.

the most expensive horse race course in the world. if you have any interest in horses or horse racing you have to see this. the worlds biggest most expensive mostest mostest (it is Dubai after all) race course.

Tre chic!. If love horse you can't miss this place..An amazing hotel, very elegant... Good food..wonderful people...If you like to smoke shisha you can do it here..Someone will take care of you helpung to chiose the taste and then you only have to wait fir an amazing horse race!Indulge @ Meydan!

far out. This has been built far out in the desert with a special beautifully made road leading upto it. It has the Meydan Hotel attached for best views & also a Tennis Centre.However it would be difficult to access if you didn't have your own transport since public transport to this area doesn't seem to exist
No Races - Just golf & the bar.. Went to golf at night. Awesome course. Great bar after with Pool, foosball and darts. Large Screens to watch TV and great service.

hot air balloon and lanterns. first time we've been here was in november 2011 when they had the hot air balloon and lantern activities... was definitely one of the most amazing scene... hope they could make it an annual activity here in dubai..after the lantern show, we came here during other weekend family activities and we've seen horse parade just once.. ;)
Out of season visit. Stayed at hotel out of season and delighted with the hotel, location and facilities. Can imagine how wonderful the atmosphere is during horse racing season.

For the World Cup. So, I went to the World Cup there, so I'm not sure if this counts, as it wasn't a typical experience. But, parking was a nightmare. We had a parking pass given to us by someone in the Royal Family, so it was great parking, but totally impossible to find our car at the end of the night (you'd think it would be easy to spot the x3 in a lot full of Bugattis and Bentleys, but we were so turned around and my feet hurt so much from my shoes that we ended up being two barefoot gals running around the parking lot. Ok, enough about parking. The place is huge and beautiful. Lots of security. Lots of people trying to get into places they aren't allowed haha, we saw several women doing what is equivalent to "sweet talking their way backstage", but to security's credit, they held their own. Food was great, we were high up so had a wonderful view. The crowd was strange, many expats who didn't even care where they were, seemed that they didn't even know there was a horserace going on (but who can blame them, those big hats can be distracting).
Dubai Gold Cup. Fantastic upmarket racecourse, no betting though and not many ladies here. Great to have a look around the place and free entry.

Bubbly Brunch at the Meydan. A lovely afternoon spent with friends and our 4 children. All in all 6 adults and 8 children. There was a bouncy castle set up,tables and chairs with pencils and paper and a children's Buffett area with options available even for the fussiest little eaters. The children were happy which meant U.S. adults could enjoy our time together. The food was delicious and there was anything you could want in a Buffett. Everything was there. A large desert section and a large bread section. The service was fast and the plates were cleared away very quickly so no build up of dirty plates at the table. The toilets were very clean.

A lavish spectacular extravaganza. The Dubai Races at the Meydan are truly extravagant and spectacular. At least once in a lifetime experience. The Races themselves are quite charged and exhilarating. Additionally in the boxes, the food/ drinks are quite lavish and continuous.Added to this the entertainment concludes the evening.Global singers complete the night but usually they come on quite late. SO while you may enjoy the races , by the time the entertainment comes up you are either too exhausted with the excitement or had one too many. But ideal for the young at heart.

Well maintained, classy. Very picturesque, green course - an amazing view in the desert. Quite far from the city and the surrounding hotel and infrastructure is a little over the top. Very expensive restaurants. But the viewing galleries and facilities within are world class and worth atleast a visit

Visit to the Dubai World Cup. This venue is a horse racing track and is only worth a visit on race days. If you want to have a flavour of expat Dubai then visit it on World Cup Day. This is the richest race meeting in the world and takes place at the end of March usually around the 28th.If you like crowds and mingling then the lawn areas offer great vibe. Don't arrive to early as after the races there is usually a top entertainer to sing for you into the early hours of the morning.If you prefer a relaxed environment then book a restaurant seat where you can relax with friends and family.

A good night out. We went to see a couple of races, apparently you cannot gamble, so that takes the pressure off, and saves your cash. a great experience we got up close to the horses on the track and in the winners ring. lots of eating places and you can get a drink,

Fun afternnoon at the Races.. My husband, my in-laws and I went to the races in the late afternoon, on New Year's Eve, before heading out to a party. We had seats outside, near the presentation area and right at the track. We was a fun few hours watching the races and making our private wagers on who would win in each race. There was also drinks and food available, just inside, with some delicious choices. The downsides:Although you could bring your drinks outside and they would serve you drinks outside, you could not eat outside. So if you wanted to eat, you had to go inside and stay in. They had screens up so you could still watch the race, but it would have been nice to have had the option of eating outside too.When we arrived there was a cue at the main entrance and one of the guards waved us through another entrance. This was great and we quickly went to our seating area which was quite far away from the main entrance. This was a mistake.....Although gambling is not permitted in the UAE, you could make predictions on which horses would win and if your predictions were correct, then you could win money. However, we got all the way to our seating area to find out that you had to pick these prediction forms at the main entrance. They did not have any available with the person you submitted the forms to in our section. We did not realise this (the guards who waved us through never said) and we had no time to go all the way back to the main entrance to get some. This did not detract from the fun time we had, but it was a little annoying as we were looking forward to making our predictions on the races.Anyway, a day at the races is good thing to try. They also have an Ascot type affair there each year, so that would be another fun event to attend at Meydan Racecourse.
day at the races. excellent day out at the dubai millions will be back next year,concert after always good this year kylie last year j lo
Amazing Venue, Amazing experience. I recommend this venue for concerts and the races!! Parking at Meydan Racecourse is very convenient too.

Night golf in Dubai at Meydan. Flood-lit golf course allows you to play at night in Dubai where the days are often too hot to play during the day time. Fun experience. Don't hit the ball outside the fairway area as the rough is not lighted. Many lost balls.

Mayday hotel - like a labyrinth!. I came to the Meydan Hotel for a congress over a few days in May 2015. Man, that hotel's layout is so confusing! Floors suddenly end, elevators take you to some floors but not others (why???), signage is terrible, staff don't know enough English to advise you on where you need to go. Also, there is a lot of construction going on, and the hotel (given it's connected to the racecourse) is pretty much in the middle of nowhere. I have no idea what the rooms and facilities are like (beyond their conference rooms), but if you're travelling to Dubai, I advise you to stay somewhere more centrally located.

Quiet Lunch. If your looking for a quiet getaway for lunch in Dubai the Meydan Hotel at the race course has a coffee shop and restaurant on the ground floor and sitting out on the terrace one is overwhelmed with the scale of the building sweeping around the race track and the wonderful expanses of green grass in all directions… Best to go in cooler months so you can enjoy the terrace..the World Cup meetings are also something that needs to be done once in your life…bit hectic at times and very crowded but well worth a visit

Great venue. Tiers restaurant is a great place to enjoy a meal. Overlooks the finish line to watch the horse racing. Excellent value, superb quality of food, service excellent, would definitely recommend

Dubai World Cup. If you want to be part of the biggest horse race in the World, don't miss the DWC. It's fantastic day out with lot's trendy people who like lots of fun and its a chance to put on your Sunday best and impress. The standard of racing is the best in the World and only the super best take the prizes!

Huge Racecourse. A beautiful place to go to in winters.The horse racing is worth a watch with all the Big shots of UAE.This place can be enjoyed froom the restuarants and bars located in the Meydan Hotel

Awesome Property. Amazing experience is the world, a property located little off beat from the center of the town but , a mix of excellent luxury and Dubai Race course, many movies have been shot here

world cup amazing, dinner amazing, breakfast with the stars. went there to have dinner at a balcony in the buffet and had an amazing dinner including variated food from all Asia, Lebanese, Thai, Chinese,etc and also occidental food. Furthermore, also went to this years Dubai Wold Cup and there is nothing left to say, if you have the possibility dont doubt and go! Also assisted to Breakfast with the Stars this year from 6am to 12pm, luxury breakfast full of horse related people, horses training, interviews and amazing food. Cool experience and all of them very different one from the other! Amazing architecture also, and full of luxury in the inside.

Super restaurant and atmosphere. We paid for a combined entrance and restaurant ticket, where we had a 3 course meal included. We were quickly sown to our table which had a superb view over the racecourse and finish line. The staff were immaculately dressed and mannered. Nothing was too much trouble for them. The food was amazing and the service was exemplary. From our table we had good views over the paddocks where we could see the horses parading before and after each race. Large TV screens enabled us to see close up how the race was progressing. A wonderful evening was had by our family.

Go here for the Dubai world cup!. Go for the world cup.. it' an amazing experience and it's like a free concert at the end with some very good performers over the last few years e.g J LO, kylie minogue. The style is unlike any other race event in the world, but that's partially why I love it. Be as crazy as you want. They wear ball gowns nearly and get away with it!!!
Venue for the World's richest horse race.!. The swankiest most well maintained horse racing course in the region..Is used for rock concerts and big social events as well.
Horse racing destination . Its very huge horse racing course..The building is unique and very huge..So busy during the Hourses world cup..

One of the best in the world who love to see horse-races. As I knew the old Meydan Race course very well, I was really curious to find out about the new one. Well, for my opinion it became too big and too show-off. Architecualwise a very interesting interpretation, including the Meydan Hotel. But see yourself....

A great concert venue. Attended the AIBA awards at the Maydan Racecourse. The venue is great and spacious. I would recommend balcony seats as the view is better. The openness of the venue makes it spacious and less claustaphorbic.

An experience to be done at least once. As expected the Dubai Gold Cup experience is truly spectacular from the build up to the races through to the fireworks and celebrity guest appearance; this year Kylie Minogue. We really enjoyed ourselves and a great place to people watch but probably the biggest surprise we had not anticipated was quite how boring it would be; I imagine on a second visit you'd struggle to keep enthralled. The racing starts a little later in the afternoon and goes on into the evening, followed by fireworks and music/dancing. One thing we had not considered till we got there, which is stupid really, as we've been to Dubai loads of times, is there is no gambling so no putting on bets for the races. Now having been to major races both in England and Ireland, half of the excitement is running in between races to put some small token bet on the next race then running back to your seats or walking round to look at the horses - we've had great fun with our 8 year old, who always picks the 'prettiest' one with the nicest mane braid. It's just a bit of family fun, not serious and we always walk away a few quid down but that's half the fun and keeps you interested. Here you don't really get up in between races other than refreshments so the afternoon can really drag on a bit with not a lot to look forward to other than people watching (the event oozes wealth!) the fireworks and show at the end. So if you have never done it, by all means it's a once in a lifetime day/evening out, but if you love the atmosphere at the Curragh and racing to see the horses, the jockeys and quickly putting a small bet on then you might be a little disappointed.
amazing. I m a little one sided as my friend built this place he was the project manager it truly is a fantastic place to visit and stay the infinity pool on the roof is breathh taking.
Aamzing!. Great and remarkable opportunity to have a horse course and training. Possibility to arrange small races and competitions.

Fireworks, Horses, Fun!. Meydan Racecourse is a great place to visit in March. Usually it's the Race Time, so you will be able to see great horse race, enjoy a great day with friends and drinks outside, see one of the best fireworks in the world as well as dance till the early hours and watch the performance of some big star such as Jennifer Lopez, Kylie Minogue. There is someone new every year. Don't forget to book your tickets in advance as well as decide what you gonna wear. Gentlemen usually wear a tux, a black suit and even a top hat, while ladies dress-code is an elegant dress and a piece of art head piece. Attention: The best dressed couple wins a valuable prize, while the best-dressed female with stunning hair-do and a head piece has a chance to win a luxury car, such as Jaguar, for example. Get ready and go for it!:)

Sureal Racing in Wonderland. As a life long horse racing enthusiast I was thrilled at the opportunity to have a VIP pass to this years World Cup Championships. It was made all the special by having friends Eclipse award winning trainer Jeff Bonde and California Chrome along with his trainer Art Sherman there as well.The facility must be seen to be believed. Approximately 11 stories with a hotel and an infinity pool on the top level...breathtaking. The opulent luxuries ooze from every corner.
