There were 80,000 people, not a single racing form, not a single ticket, no one handicapping or engrossed in trying to figure out their next wager as there was no wagering of any sort. It was like the twilight zone. Even web sites linked to online gambling were blocked. The merciful Sheik simply builds a racing palace, and puts up $30,000,000 in purses while inviting the world's best horses to compete against his best horses with all expenses paid. Bizare. When you venture inside the magnificantly appointed grand stands you are greeted by an open bar, a lavish buffet and a music group playing on a stage near by. They don't even pipe the call of the race inside. The races are more of a carnival than a handicapping challenge to be conquered. In an era of fiscal austerity and closing decaying facilities it was in disbelief that I glanced off to the distance and so the prestine grounds of the former race track, a exact duplicate of Churchhill downs abandoned yet meticulously maintained.Amid the world's tallest building, the world's only 7 star hotel and the ability to ride a camel across a nearby set of dunes, Meydan Racecourse stands out as another must do experience...particularly when they are racing.

One for a Winter Night Out. Everyone has heard of the Dubai Gold Cup horse race, but forget all the bling of that day out, an evening at Meydan is a fantastic way to spend a few hours in Dubai doing something different. The entry is very affordable, and once track side you have a seat and a full view of the course. You can get food and drink (including wine and beer) and can even walk up to the track itself to get close to the horses. Highly recommend for an alternative night out during racing season. Note it's casual - jeans and sweaters, boots or flat shoes.

A racecourse in the midst. We have never attended this venue to stay yet, or to attend a musical event or horse race. I personally will not contribute my earnings to horse racing. However the grandness of this building, is quite impressive. The inside of the building feels like you stepped into something grand and chic, and the views at night across the course are quite peaceful. There is a stillness out there. The food at the smorgasboard restaurant (sorry cannot remember the name) was okay. Just that, the price was fantastic, and the view was great. The array of options was not vast. This place feels a little bit further out from Dubai. Which is nice sometimes. :)

Dubai Gold Cup. What an amazing racecourse truly fabulous experience. Have been interested in racing for many years & have been to quite a few in the UK with the idea of Meydan on my bucket list & now it's ticked!! The whole afternoon & evening racing was wonderful followed by the best firework display ever then Kylie !! The food & drink outlets were plentiful & reasonably priced a well enjoyed day .....
Fabulous Venue to enjoy with friends and family!. Reserve a booth when going to the horse races. They serve fabulous food and great beverages to you and 50+ friends.

Breathtaking Venue. This place is amazing! the building itself is one of the longest in the world, being over 1km Long! This place is huge! I recommend you come to a raceday at Meydan, it will not disappoint!!
Great view of the race course. Huge space for MICE events. Nice view of the race course. Conveniently located. A great place for big events. We had our tradeshow party there and we enjoyed a lot.
Dubai World Cup. Loved everything I was there the day before the race and had a look around, on race day it was superb
Lovely. I love it ...amazing ,relaxing ..Ive been with mu hustband and we walk around we staop for a coffe and we did some shopping ! it s wow . Absolutly beautiful..

What a View. Our first experience. Tickets brought by friends - included four course dinner, drinks and of course a fabulous view of the racing. Full table service, friendly and attentive staff. Fun with a group of friends.

Rather disappointing. I was excited about our visit to the Meydan as one would expect that it would be as palatial and opulent as the rest of the city.Sadly I have to put in behind the likes of Ascot, Sha Tin in Hong Kong and even Cheltenham’s panoramic restaurant.The staff were find and the food was OK but I was hoping for rather more..

Day out at Dubai world cup. Great day at the races and Kylie Minogue finished it off. Fantastic! Don't worry so much about the dress code that is advertised! The food was fast food style with a few bars. Careful of some of the "dance moves", we kept our distance! (Ahem!)
Varage with poor service. We sat outside and were very slow to be served and the food was only average. It was well overpriced for what we got. The view is nice however.

A great day out at the races!. Great ambiance, happy people decently priced food and beverages. Quest were a little too long but that's only to be expected at the Dubai World Cup!! We will definitely be visiting again next year.

Awesome. I happened to visit races right before world cup... with my friends and sister. It was one of the most amazing and fantastic experience of my life. Before going to race i knew nothing about horses and race. But it was so eady to understand and i enjoyed a lot. Being there felt so royal lol
World cup fun!. Brilliant atmosphere, array of food options in the Apron views area... looking forward to next years event!

Simply Magnificant. You don't have to be a Horse Racing Buff to enjoy the spectacle here - admittedly we came to watch the Dubai world Cup - but the whole splendour & orginisation of this place puts most other racecourse (& sports arenas) to shame - 1 mile ... yes 1 mile of Grandstands - seating for 70,000 spectators - lush green grass & luxurious surroundings - the inside is vast beautiful & spacious - Definitely on the 'to do' list

Dubai World Cup!. Horse racing aficionados, we were delighted with the excitement and glamour of this race day, particularly for the beauty and power of the horses. Veteran people watchers, got a lot of enjoyment at seeing the 'passing show', particularly the wonderful hats worn for the occasion.
Great experience. Went to the Dubai World Cup and thoroughly recommend a visit if you are in Dubai. Excellent value, shame you can't have a bet.

Horse Racing-World Cup. We went to the World Cup Horse racing event and BEWARE of the type ticket that you purchase for this event. We purchased "general admission" which was a significant amount less than the "Apron View" ticket. The views were the same, however it was less crowded on the Apron view side and there was significantly more "Westerners." We sat with many "locals" and what appeared to be tribes people from all over Africa. We didn't have seating available, the food court was overwhelmingly crowded and overall it wasn't the best experience. The race course was nice to visit if you are planning to watch an event. Definitely take heed, however to your seating.

Friday Brunch. Enjoyed the Friday Brunch at Farriers. A massive selection of good quality food, everything from seafood, salad bar, oriental, an outdoor BBQ where food was cooked to order and my favourite part, the cocktail station!!! There was a also a decent live band on which made for a really enjoyable afternoon. Good value!

Great Night. We booked to go to the races while in England and picked up out tickets at the races on the day. We payed 75 quid per person to go into the Silks restaurant, this included superb complimentary food and drinks. Well worth the money whilst in Dubai as the prices of the drinks are very high. The view of the racing from the restaurant balcony was great.Well worth the money and the best night in Dubai.
Brilliant venue for the family.. I have a few secrets about this place and I will never share them with anyone :-) see for yourself and revert with a review.

Dubai World Cup. Had a fabulous day at the World Cup Races, as with everything in Dubai the facilities are superb. Drinks not overly expensive, good selection of food. We had been worried about the heat - but when the racing started at 4pm the sun had moved behind the stadium.It ended with one of the best firework displays I have seen - and another highlight Kylie Minogue to finish off a perfect day.Transportation after the evening show was brilliant an army of buses free of charge ferried the thousands to different area's of Dubai where numerous taxi's waited, so we hadn't to wait an hour for taxi's from the stadium. So well thought out.

Dubai World Cup. Race course and facilities are superb - puts many UK race courses to shame. The World Cup ended with a fantastic fireworks display - nothing like we have ever seen before. Toilets/Catering facilities clean and no lengthy queues.

Longest Hotel. This Hotel is slightly far from the city=> Less Crowded=> Unique Restaurent=> If you are a tourist try to avoid this as you taxi bill will come a lot=> You can go there and enjoy there meals.

This was a Birthday Treat for my birthday. I thoroughly enjoyed my day at the races, I haven't been to a racecourse before so I really enjoyed it, especially with it being the World Cup, I enjoyed seeing everyone dressed up and just people watching really.
World Cup. Brilliant viewing and access with Gallery tickets inc alcoholic drinks, afternoon tea followed by hot buffet meal.

Dubai Races. Disliked the complete lack of service and cleanliness in The Apron. area....also the extremely poor choice & quality of food & seating in that area on World Cup Day. On my previous visit I thought the place had 'teething' problems but it was more crowded & unclean this time. Nobody seemed to be concerned or oversee the comfort of the ticket holders.

A very special day out.. I visited Meydan for the World Cup final day, - it was something I had wanted to do for some time.We booked places in the Sky Bubble, and found the food and drinks to be of a very high quality indeed; nobody was going to go hungry or thirsty in there!The view of the races was excellent, but the lack of any crowd noise diminished the atmosphere a little.Everything at the course ran like clockwork, and I would go again like a shot!PS - just like the people have said, be prepared for a very, very long queue for a taxi afterwards!

Mixed feelings. Great race but facilities are average. I loved the racecourse itself, it was exciting and astonishing to watch the horses. Fashion show by ladies and gents in terms of dresses and hats was also lots of fun. However facilities are definitely to be improved. Number of ladies bathrooms is so limited, that one has to spend up to 45 in the queue to get in and miss lots of racecourse. Food variety is not wow also, perhaps could bring some higher level food options for those willing to pay but eat healthier.
Amazing experience. Visited the course during a race night whilst staying at the hotel for a sporting event. Fab building and decor, helpful staff and incredible viewing areas for the races.

Dubai World Cup. I was in Dubai for this very important horserace this year. The Meydan racecourse is a huge and organized facility that, even with thousands of people attending the race on that day, kept its organization and offered a great show for the public.
lovely place. It was a great venue that I explored on the World cup day very well organised, huge parking, good food and the race was awesome !

Great day out. We went to the last night of the Dubai Gold Cup. Great fun, excellent for people watching, great fireworks and after races concert featuring the wonderful Kylie Minogue. If you do go either leave a bit early to get a taxi in a timely manner or else you may find yourself with a bit of a wait.
Great day out. Top class race day in Dubai. again i love this place it has great food clean and above all standards way above what you get in the uk

If you are not crazy about horse races and don´t mind missing the show at the end of the race, go for the cheapest ticke. If you are not crazy about horse races and don´t mind missing the show at the end of the race, go for the cheapest ticket. This applies to the most important race day of the year. It´s great to look at the wonder of this infrastructure. It is just huge. Again, if you don´want to spend the entire day there and don´t mind staying with the common people, jsut go for the cheapest ticket (Dhs 25) and see a few races. You´ll get most of what the ones who paid US$100( and much above ) did.

its the best no doubt about that. we attended this years 20th running of the dubai gold cup. we had booked entry passes at £85 pp approx this got us in to the apron viewing area, we had to attend the ticket office on arrival to pick ours up and had no trouble at all, we were in a que for no more than 5mins, as we had the apron views tickets we did not have to que to enter either, we went through security and entered the grandstand, there was loads an loads going on with entertainment of the highest order ! all people are dressed in their finery so the occasion is special ! we made our way to our area which was decked with picnic tables and umbrellas and close to the bars, prices were not to bad with bottles of water at £1 then pints of beer at £8 and measures of spirits at £8 also. food court must hold 15-20 places to eat and all approx £10 pp for burger/pizza with chips and a soft drink. the racing finished with a spectacular firework display the likes of which i have never experienced before ( i have seen Edinburgh at the new year) and this put it in the shade so to speak ! after display an announcement was made and kilye minouge was driven along the track and on to a stage where she performed ! free to all who stayed behind ! we left at approx 1am fairly exhausted but very elated ! would go again tomorrow !! it is by far the biggest and most glamorous of all horse racing venues worldwide and everybody within the horse racing fraternity and further afield should go if they get the chance it is spectacular !!

A dream come true. One of the main reasons we went to Dubai. We were lucky enough to go to the Dubai world cup, we got general admission tickets and for less than £10 for 2 adults and 1 child this was amazing. Get there early and you can bag great seats near the winners enclousre for a fraction of the price of the next level entry.

Dubai World Cup 2015. What a fabulous day out this was. We booked Premium Seating and although we thought these expensive, we decided they were worth the money.The open bar, afternoon tea and evening buffet were all very good with a wide selection of food and drink. The service was excellent and every one so helpful and friendly.The racing was, as you would expect, of a very good quality - made all the better that I managed to get 5 winners!!Fantastic firework display after racing and Kylie was superb. Wish they had shown her on the big screens.Little bit chaotic afterwards waiting for taxis, but what can you expect. We were directed to get one of the many free buses to take us to the Trade Centre and get a taxi from there. Seemed like a good idea, but on arriving at the Trade Centre there was no taxi queue as such. Not many taxis about and it was just a free for all. All in all a brilliant day and we hope to do it again.

Hot... Hot.... Hot.... Hot. Crazy hot outside, Cool and air conditioned inside. Thats all that mattered to me :)The food was good, the lobby was amazing to hang out in and the people were, as always in Dubai, Interesting

World Cup - Best Race date yet!!. What a place to view some of the best horse racing in the world. Excellent views anywhere you stand or sit. We had Apron views and the atmosphere was fantastic, very safe no hassle (unlike UK venues) and great drinking areas in the warmth of the desert sun. All made better by several winners.The food court sold one of the best pizzas I've had and Kylie finished off the event after some awesome fireworks All in all a very impressive place, well organised, clean and the building itself IMPRESSIVE.

world cup. Great days racing at a terrific venue, with fantastic viewing from any spot.Buffet,drinks and facilities were very good.Only thing i will say is don't expect the atmosphere you find at the races in England.
DWC 2015. What an awesome experience - you have to do this once in your life! The best racing facility in the world!!!
"Gorgeous". One of the best horse racing events i have ever attended in my life.This place is gorgeous and at the same time a nice view and relaxation of mind after a long weekday events of work.

Stunning venue. Booked last minute to come to Dubia was not able to get tickets for the races from the course so had to buy through agency. Yep over priced.Sat in the gallery on the winning line so great views of the racing and even better I had four winners.Buffet afternoon tea and dinner was good and plenty full and the open bar was adequate.Kylie Monogue was playing after the racing but was to far away for us to see her perform.This was the only down side to the day you couldn't get close enough to watch her perform.It would have been better if they put her performance up on the big screen.

What a place. Spent a day here for the World Cup had such a lovely time met some really nice people They really know how to put on a good show. fabulous firework display and Kylie minogue in concert she was great. Really enjoyable only moan was a trying to get back to hotel as there was not enough taxis for the amount of people in the stadium. Worth a visit

Maydan stable tour - absolutely worth it!. The stable tour is fantastic! It runs from about 7:30AM to about noon and the cost was 250 AED per person. It starts with a buffet breakfast at the Meydan Hotel - which was very good. Then you enter a bus and they take you to various parts of the racetrack/stables. We were able to see/touch many of the horses and get pictures with them.  We met the farrier and learned quite a bit from him. He was very gracious and answered all our questions (Sorry, I did not get his name. Was it Alan???). He was really quite knowledgeable and was quite easy to speak with. He even gave us an old horseshoe as a souvenir.  We also got to see the equine 'swimming pool'....the jockeys' dressing room....some real saddles/boots.... the winner's circle...and a trip to the huge bubble observation deck (that's probably not the official name). Here you have great views of the Dubai skyline. A bottle of water is provided for you as it does get warm. The final stop was the exhibition where there was a movie....some information about horse racing and Dubai. The Dubai World Cup trophy was there and we were then allowed to dress up in hats and get our picture taken with it. Each person got a copy of the photo (even if you were in a group photo) and it was free. There were also some jockey outfits there that you could dress in. A lot of fun. They provided you with a bag of goodies upon completion of the tour. This included a race booklet, magazine, and baseball cap with DUBAI on it. There is a visit to the souvenir store in case you were interested in purchasing anything (mugs were a great price at only 15 AED each). The guides were superb. Mark was a great guide - never rushing, provided lots of information, very easy going. He was accompanied by Jessie (a former jockey with tons of information) and Brian (who guided us through every step). Kudos to that team. Bring a camera and maybe some water. To get to the tour, you must drive or take a taxi. Follow the signs for the HOTEL....valet parking is free.  I live in Dubai and I have to say that I enjoyed it immensely even though I don't follow horse racing. I would highly recommend this for either tourists or residents. As the title says - it's absolutely worth it!!

A great night at a spectaular racecourse. I went to a night of the World Cup of Racing Carnival and was very impressed by the experience. I have been to courses in many parts of Australia, Asia, US and UK and this is a great course. We had a dining table booked right on the window of a magnificent stand about 120 metres from the winning post. The food was very good (4 courses), there was a free flow champagne, wine and beer package and even though it is illegal to gamble, if you have a phone and an account with a corporate bookie, i don't think you would have any problems getting on. Package was about US$120. If the place had one drawback it did not have alot of atmosphere due to the size of the place and there are no punters cheering home a winner.

The most glorious thoroughbred racing venue in the world. Simply unforgettable!. For a city that strives to be the biggest and best in the world, this racetrack is right on par. As if the sheer size and beauty isn't enough, they also make it an extravagant experience as well.I spent three days at Meydan, leading up to the Dubai World Cup. The first day featured Breakfast with the Stars during morning workouts. The tents and tables were set with beautiful decorations. The food was plentiful, delicious, and offered a great variety. The juices were very fresh and tasted spectacular. There was live music and interviews with jockeys, trainers, owners, etc. Indoors, there was a great display of all the past World Cup winning horses.After breakfast, we walked toward the Meydan hotel to go to the Meydan museum. It was small, but high quality. It's free, but they ask you to "register" by typing your email address on an iPad. The museum starts with a short video about Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, and his vision to promote horse racing in Dubai, and his ascent from beginning Godolphin to adding Darley, growing Dubai, to the present day glory of the Dubai World Cup. Most of the museum exhibit is a timeline of events, but there are a few artifacts, and we did get to see the trophy that would be presented to the owner of the winning horse of the World Cup. You get a personal guide who accompanies you through the museum. I think some guides are better than others. Ours stood silently next to us, and made me feel awkward, while others were actively explaining things to their guests. The highlight of the museum is the lifelike recreation of Dubai Millenium, Sheikh Mohammed's Godolphin horse who won the World Cup in 2000. There was amazing attention to detail in making that statue a perfect recreation of that horse at exactly the moment that he crossed the wire in the World Cup. At the end, you get your picture taken with the horse, and you get the picture, a hat, and a pen in a neat Dubai bag for free.The next day we went to the track for morning workouts which started peacefully under the lights, featuring the highest quality horses from throughout the world. Then we were treated to a brilliant desert sunrise before workouts wrapped up.World Cup day was as epic as you would expect. The races themselves were larger than life, and there was always something to keep you entertained. The evening culminated in a celebration of the United Arab Emirates honoring the guests who visited from throughout the world. There were musical performances, dancing, and the most amazing fireworks display anyone has ever seen.Meydan truly is an unbelievable place. Every race fan should make it their goal to visit once in their lifetime.

What an experience. We went to Dubai specifically for the Dubai World Cup - the last day of the Meydan Festival. We were in the First Class Lounge which is well worth the expense, the atmosphere was brilliant, the food was very good, all of the staff were very polite and excellent view of the racing, the fireworks at the end and the live show

Great experience. Went for the Dubai World Cup Day. Food was really fabulous and plenty of it. Worth paying to be in the seating area (near the finishing post). Was surprised you could take your drinks to your seat, with a holder for your beer. Free food and drink all day. Advise you to go past the first area you come to (packed out). Go through turn right for 40 yards to another entry point. Loads of room and same food, only no queues. The fireworks display was better than any Disney ones I have seen. Concert by Kylie Minogue was really good, although it would have been great to see it from the stand where we were.

Dubai world cup. I loved this day. It was an amazing experience. Only cost approx £4.00 for general arena. Very close view of the horses and the track. Much more extravagant than any race in England. Saw Michael Owen. The Dubai royal family. And Kylie Minogue closed the show. It was an amazing day.

Dubai World Cup. What an experience for such a great price. We were able to go and get general admission for very cheap. It looks more like a football stadium from the outside than a horse track. If you can go for a race I would recommend it. Only downside is there is not betting allowed at the track.
Loved the race!. Had a great time at World Cup. Loved the show and fireworks! Parking was a bit of a hassle, but getting out after was easier than expected.

World Cup 2015 Review. Overall a great experience and I would definitely return to attend the World Cup again in the future. For people familiar with Dubai you'll be used the shambolic organisation of logistics and the poor communication of information. We booked tickets for the Gallery (around £275 per head). The info pack told us to go to Gate F. When the taxi dropped us off we asked several members of staff where Gate F was located. Some said that it was next to Gate C, others said that there was no Gate F. We actually needed to access Gate A but it took some time to discover this. The Gallery tickets provided food and drink all day. Staff manning the bars were just about the worst bar staff imaginable - many had little grasp of English. We had to teach the first barman how to make a Gin and Tonic!Food was actually superb. Great range of fish, salads, hot curries, sushi and Italian dishes on the buffet. Even though this is the biggest event of the year at this location the atmosphere does not match any large horse racing event in the UK. The crowd are very subdued, there's not much cheering and the stand is so big that it always feels half full. Getting home is not easy - everyone leaves after the concert so there are no taxis available. Buses took us all to the city and dropped us at a Metro station but the last metro had left about an hour earlier. Hundreds of people were then roaming the streets looking for a taxi. Even though it seems like an expensive ticket we got food and drink all day, really good access to the horses and jockeys and got to see Kylie in concert so we were at the track for 10 hours. There's also a very impressive firework display after the last race.

Great day but lacks atmosphere other than World Cup Day. Meydan is a spectacular horse racing track. Perhaps the best in the world. But as with sporting facilities of this size, it needs the crowds to bring atmosphere and do it justice. Also the absense of betting facilities will reduce the impact to Westerners who are used to this adding to 'the package' of a day at the races.
Great access to the horses and the racecourse. You could go right up and touch the horses! You get to go down into the jockey's room and out into the winner's circle. Really enjoyed it

Top billing. It was our second visit to the Tiered Restaurant and just like the first visit the food and service were hard to fault. I recommend a night out, even if you are not a horse racing fan as it is always fun, with a chance to win a few prizes and also the meal is great value for money and the wines served are more than acceptable. It's a pity the wine no longer included champagne but I gather the Prosecco soon became a good substitute. For all visitors to Dubai I recommend a night out and for those hard up if at the end of your holiday it is free entry to watch and still get the chance of winning.

Racing at Meydan. We had an enjoyable evening at Meydan racecourse, although regular British race goers who we met there were disappointed at the lack of atmosphere, There is no Gambling in UAE. And this they felt detracted fro their enjoy,net. However, we enjoyed the spectacle of the racing .

Superb Silks. 2 nights racing whilst we were in Dubai. We had an absolutely fantastic evening on both occasions. Excellent choice of food and drink, brilliant waiters/ waitresses. Good views of the racing if you get a table by the window, however, there is a terrace where you can watch and savour the atmosphere. Great value for a night out.

Maydan. Fantastic building and course. Whether at the Maydan Hotel for a meal or the tack for the races, the whole atmosphere is astounding. A dinner on the terrace whilst the races are on is a great experience. Watch the horses, which are treated like kings and in magnificent condition.
Great value restaurant. Brilliant value, wonderful attentive staff - excellent food! We had a great seat directly over the winners enclosure, couldn't have been happier.

Fantastic day out. I was invited by friends to spend a Saturdy afternon with them at Silks restaurant at the racecourse to watch several races....my first visit and hopefuly not the last.... A great day out in very impressive surroundings watching first-class racing
very big. very big and very beautiful, for a while you will forget that there was dessert around, little far from city center but worth the visit

Great to watch the Night Raes. Fantastic to sit on the balcony and watch the horse racing at night! The horse races are not on all year round due to the heat but if you're there when they are on - do stay at the Meydan Hotel

Truly awesome. Totally a league above and beyond UK racecourses. Very civilised and orderly, luxurious and a sight to see. The biggest and most manicured racecourse I have ever been to. We had dinner there with a view overlooking the ring which was fascinating to see the beautiful horses so closely. Obviously the only drawback is you can't bet but it didn't ruin our experience. The food was very nice and the service was good too. Easy drop off and pick up points right outside for taxis etc. A real must if you can.

Owners and Trainers. Really enjoyed the décor of the hotel with a fantastic view of the race track a must when visiting Dubai. What a place that is built in the city. And the atmosphere on race days no were in the world will feel better.
What a place.. amazing atmosphere, and the place is huge, well worth going to what can only be described as a land scraper!!

Incredible Venue. This is a must see for the horse blood type. It's an over-the-top facility, with everything from fine dining, to night club. One problem- no wagering allowed. Strange to visit the track and not loose money on the ponies, but... Incredible bloodstock, obviously, given Sheik's investment. It has to be the most impressive structure every built for this use. Had a great time and will come back for the World Cup next year.

Super Saturday. Booked Silks for this event. Had a wonderful time with a wonderful buffet and as we booked the drinks package there was a plentiful supply of beers sparkling wine shorts etc. The service was excellent and even though you cannot place bets due to their laws you get a type of lottery form which can win you prizes if you pick the winners. A thoroughly enjoyable day which we would like to repeat.

Great Experience. We booked the Silks Buffet on one of the World Cup racing days. It was a lovely evening and I thoroughly enjoyed the experience although didn't have any winners. We were lucky enough to have passes to the winners enclosure so could see everything really close up.

Down at course level. My wife and I enjoy going to the races on Thursday nights at the Meydan, but apart from the World Cup we don't pay to go into the upmarket areas. Most of the time we go in the free areas and mix with all the 'workers' who come for a free night out. Down at ground level you get a chance to hang over the rail at the parade ground, smell the atmosphere, then just turn around and watch the race on the enormous screens and see them pass the winning post. Turn back around and watch them come right past you into the winners enclosure. You can get a OK shawarma between races if you're prepared to join the disorganised queue, no alcohol at this level, for that you need to pay to get in the stands.But for a free evening out and if you want a very outside chance to win on one of the many race prediction games then go down market at course level. It's totally free, free parking, free entry, free programme and race schedule, that has to be amazing value. At the parade ground rail you may even get spoken to by one of the owners, maybe even one of the Sheikhs, which has happened to us or our guests more than once.

Got to do this. Amazing. Full stop. The best horse racing venue! Booked the silks restaurant. Food, drink and service was first rate. Dress code is smart casual. Men are ok in jeans and a shirt. Girls dressed up a little more. Really worth it. Great experience. No betting is weird but we placed our bets before hand and so still has that excitement. Will definitely return next year.

What an Experience!. My husband and I have never bet on anything! However, going to the races is truly an awesome experience! We always get seats under the apron near the parade ring. It's great to see the perfectly-groomed horses parade before the races. We still don't have a clue about choosing horses, but the experiences is truly worth it!
Lovely buffet. Nothing to dislike - good buffet, limited a bit but lovely nevertheless. Great staff too who were very attentive.

Professional Gathering. Food and ambiance is good.......Race course is well maintained.....Its one of its kind Sports based luxury resort.... Nice Place to visit and experience a different world of sports.....

Love Horse Racing?. Meydan Racecourse is a horse racing facility located in Dubai, United Arab Emirates. It opened on 27 March 2010, replacing Nad Al Sheba Racecourse, which formerly occupied the same site. It can accommodate over 60,000 spectators in a 1 mile-long grandstand. When not used for races it will serve as a business and conference integrated facility. A horse racing museum and gallery are also planned. The development also includes a nine-hole golf course. The 7.5 million m² Meydan Racecourse includes Meydan Marina, The Meydan – the world's first five-star track-side hotel with 285 rooms, two race tracks and the Grandstand, which comprises a hotel, restaurants, a racing museum and 72 corporate suites for entertaining throughout the year. It has a 2,400 metre left-handed turf race track and a left-handed 8.75-furlong (1,750 metres) Tapeta synthetic dirt course. It operates from November through March and features the Winter Racing Challenge, Dubai International Racing Carnival and the Dubai World Cup Night. The Dubai World Cup is the world's richest race day with over US$26.25 million in prize money.
horses and classy races. the best one can come across. the best horse flesh around the world competes here on the racecourse. the best arabian pure bloodline can be watched in action here.
Silks at the races. Great food great service great views of course 80 quid inc lovely buffet and all alcohol at meetings would reccomend
Best. We liked everything about this place from start to finish could not fault anything from stable visit to eating in hotel everything was 5* plus a few more

Off my Bucket list .. We are regular attending British Racetracks this compares with our best Ascot or York . The facilities are top class. We Paid 100 DHS each ( approx £20 ) for parade ring lounge tickets with tiered seating near the finish line . Better value then any we've been to .We had a great days racing and a fantastic experience. Taxis to the venue in fact Taxis in Dubai are totally reasonable . Their is no on course betting but the course provide free place tickets for each race .

Best Horse Track Course I have ever seen. There is not much to say. It is a race horse where everything is perfectly fixed (track and services). It is located next to Meydan Hotel so if you are at Hotel it is just there.

great racing. Visited last Thursday and Saturday race evening events, dining in the tiered restaurant. We had a brilliant view on both nights with our table in the middle tier directly above the parade ring and near finish line. The meals were awesome on both nights and the young man who served us was friendly and efficient, very commendable as he told us he was a trainee and the Thursday was his first race night. I would recommend these events, value for money and will definitely go again.

Stunning Place for a night out. Stunning Race Course. you will love this place even if you are not into horse racing. went on a Thursday. Tickets are affordable. also you can chose packages which includes more fun and closer view for a good price. food and drinks were serviced to our seats. Had a really nice evening. FYI - Betting is illegal in UAE

World Cup Carnival - February 2015. I visited Meydan for the World Cup Carnival meets on the 26th and 28th of February. The grandstand and facilities are immense - think Ascot but about triple the size!I caught a taxi from the nearest Metro station - Business Bay (cost 25 Dirhams/around £4) and the journey takes about 10-15 minutes depending on traffic. I opted for the 50 Dirham ticket/premier seating by the finish line. Access is via Gate A and be sure to collect your free betting slip and raffle ticket as you enter. This is the only gambling allowed at the track due to UAE laws. You can also collect a free race card from the information desk located inside. One part of the betting slip involves picking the winner of each of the six nominated races (races 2-7 in my case) - the Pick 6. If you manage to do so you're likely to collect a five figure cash sum if your the only winner. You'll also collect money if you manage to pick 4 or 5 winners as well. The other part of the betting slip is the tri cast - if you get any of them up well done! The raffle ticket had seven prizes ranging from £1000 - £100 and the results were announced after race 6 on the big screen. Be sure to give this and your betting slip to staff twenty minutes before the first nominated race. All types of alcohol are served inside. I went for pints of Heineken which cost 40 dirhams/£7. Apparently alcohol is one of the few things subject to tax in the UAE which is why it's expensive. You can either buy from the bars of have a waiter bring them to your seat. Although it's a very good view in the premier seats, there was not much of an atmosphere due to the fairly low numbers in attendance. This was the case on both days I visited and was the only slight disappointment. There were seven races in total each night (non world Cup meets generally have six). The first went off at 18:45 and the last at 22:15 hours. There is a taxi rank directly outside gate A. I waited five minutes for one on the Thursday and about 15 on the Saturday. There are taxi marshals controlling the queue, they do however offer the 'Lexus' taxi which are parked on the other side of the road. These are plain, white coloured, Lexus cars that cost about three or four times the price of a standard Dubai taxi. Overall, it's definitely worth going to Meydan if you're a racing fan, even if the atmosphere is a good deal more restrained that the likes of the UK. The crowd was a good mix of locals, families, expats and tourists - all well behaved, even me!

Nice Evening. I purchased the Silks buffet package. The buffet was very well done and reasonably priced. The viewing balcony was 100 meters before the finish line. With the Silks package I could go to the ring to view the horses before the race. There is no parimutuel betting at the track.

Fun day out. Definitely buy the more expensive seats. Husband got his designer sunglasses stolen at the security check, and no one was interested when we reported it ! Still had a good day though, although took for ever to get a taxi, and decided to walk to main road to try and get one. That kind of put a cloud over the day, so,would research a taxi home before I went next time.

Briliant night out in Dubai!. Absolutely love Meydan nights out! The racecourse is stunning, set behind a spectacular hotel. you can get tickets to watch the racing for 50-100 dirhams during the racing carnival, takes place thursday/friday nights in the Winter. They serve wine and food to your seat and you can get really close to the horses andthe jockeys. It's a best kept secret and I can't beleive more people don't go!

Great Experience!!!!. We decided to celebrate Valentine's Day here as we were in Dubai & had a lovely time in their beautiful glassed in restaurant with a window seat overlooking the parading horses & the finish line. We purchased a four course meal for a fairly reasonable price & they had special things for Valentine's Day like a basket of bread in heart shapes, heart shaped chocolates with coffee etc. Good service & a great venue. As betting is illegal in the UAE it takes the edge off the visit for most non-UAE residents (you can, of course, place bets through other countries, & many people do) but for residents it's just a nice family day out with a play area for the kids & quite a few different areas to sit & food outlets to choose from. If you don't have your own car you will need to take a taxi (be careful not to take an unmarked car or it will be expensive). Coming back, the taxi line is long & the cars which arrive are mostly unmarked so you will need to negotiate a price - this is MOST important. There is a free shuttle bus which runs to Dubai Mall but it can take a while during peak times. We would definitely go again when in Dubai during their winter!!!!!

First time but won't be the last .... My houseguest suggested we go for a Dubai Carnival night (on a Thursday). She researched and booked Premier seats opposite the Winning post and although I'm not a horsey person, I thoroughly enjoyed the 'experience' ! It's worth going as it's in the cool of the evening, there is much to see and enjoy and the food and drinks (serviced to your seat) just makes it that much more enjoyable for a cheap evening out. Oh and a great night time shot of Dubai's skyline! Do try it !

Great area. Went here since they had a APC event that was being held there it's really tricky to find and yes we got a taxi and the taxi didn't even know where the Resturant was !!!!! Be careful when going and plan ahead !

SPECTACULAR FOOD IN AMAZING SURROUNDINGS. Dined in the restaurant overlooking the racetrack. An amazing experience with excellent food. The menu is very specific with regard to explaining the steaks available and recommend how they should be cooked. We sat in a window with the very high backed dining chairs; they were an experience on their own!!The food was delicious and the staff were very attentive and helpful.We were very lucky in that there was racing on the night we ate and it all added to the wonderful atmosphere.Highly recommended.

The World's largest - a must for any racing fan !. We are a pair of 70year-old racing fans (National Hunt), but our three-day stopover in Dubai, en route to Mauritius, just happened to coincide with the Carnival . . . Not up for debate !As we were staying in Deira, on the opposite side of Dubai, we used the fabulous, and incredibly cheap (£4.70 for a Day ticket to go anywhere, as often as you like) Metro to sightsee prior to then getting a short taxi ride from Downtown Dubai to the racecourse. The last race was 10.15pm, and a taxi had us back at the hotel by 11pm, for £16. Amazing - it's a long way.It is like arriving at an international airport ! The taxi driver took us to the Meydan Hotel, whereupon we were given a buggy ride to the Ticket Office ! It is so big, we'd still be walking now without that ! We paid £10 each to allow us to have a good look round, although we could have got in for free.The seating is very comfortable, with lots of space, and a drinks holder in the armrest. We had a substantial albeit snack, meal, which - with drinks - cost £20 for two. It was entirely satisfactory. The staff want to serve you in your seats; cleaning is continual, even to polishing the handrails throughout the evening.As gambling is not allowed, we were surprised to find our ticket included a 'free bet' for a Placepot-type draw. We didn't find the winners though ! Equally surprising was that alcohol was freely available, whereas in Dubai generally it is only available in tourist hotels.The no-gambling also means no bookies and therefore no betting slips and NO LITTER !!! In addition littering in the street in Dubai will cost you £100. So there isn't any. UK please note !! The horses arrive at the start by means of a subway horsewalk, so that's difficult to see. Unsaddling is right in front of the stands. However the finish is where it should be, the screens are about 100m long, and there are continually-updating times shown on another huge screen.It goes without saying that the racing is first-class, and we even had Rishi Persad commentating ! This facility is so worthy of all the superlatives. It deserves its reputation and is a must-do for any racing fan lucky enough to visit Dubai. It is a very different experience to UK racing - as it should be.

They do this well in Dubai. For me this was one of those boxes that I wanted to tick and what an impressive place this is. The food and drinks here are also very reasonably priced and if you have any interest in horse racing this is a must.
Meyden Races. Excellent value with the drinks package in the Tiered Restaurant, brilliant seats and professional friendly service.

"FREE " ....... You really need to experience this... yes its free to get in to EVERYONE , so as you can imagine all the "locals" make an evening of it , rugs picnics and kids ..... think we were only two of a handful of Europeans there !!!! ( although you can book a table there for dinner at a cost ) take a taxi there and back ,,,,
just back. Visited last week for dubai carnival stayed in the meydan hotel ,all i can say is wow.Anybody who is seriously interested in horse racing dont hesitate to pm me.

Great way to spend an evening. What a huge and amazing place - must be the best in the world! We went as a group of 4 and paid AED 100 each for the Parade Ring Lounge. The outside tables were next to the Parade Ring and the beautiful Arabian horses could be seen close up as they walked round- they are all amazing! Whilst most of the time, the starting gate was out of direct view, the 3 huge screens opposite had all the action until they came into view on the straight and thundered past the finish post in front of us.The waiters outside were very attentive and keen to keep us topped up with wine or beer. The restaurant area was very pleasant and spacious. The bar snack food was OK but Sushi was served in a plastic box, as if straight off the supermarket shelf. The cheesecake desert was the same and totally unnecessary, as there were not many diners and it would have only taken a few seconds to put it on a plate.Overall, it was a great experience and a lovely way to spend an evening.
Race course to visit. Agin, nothing to dislike. The Grand Stand is humongous very lushy and plushy. It is a palace for race goers and an honor for the horse owners to win on such a race corse.
First visit here. Went here for the Dubai Carnival and thoroughly enjoyed it. Had booked my tickets beforehand for premier seats, these did not cost much but were worth it.

Hotel, Racecourse, concert venue all in one!. Having watched the racecourse being built, it was a treat to return recently to see the finished product. Lovely to sit outside and look over the racecourse. If you are luck enough to stay in the hotel over winter you may see the horses being worked on the track in the early morning.

Excellent facility but lacking atmosphere.. We booked the tiered restaurant facility which included a 4 course dinner and alcoholic drinks in addition to the table for the evening. (Approximately 90 gbp/person)The food was very acceptable for this type of event and the young restaurant staff were helpful and attentive throughout the evening.The racing was of a good quality, alas; due to the culture of no betting the crowd's interest in the racing seemed to wain as the evening progressed.Sadly, for a stadium of such magnitude the atmosphere was lacking - for us it was simply a "nice" evening at the races without being exciting or in the least bit exhilarating.I daresay the crowds and atmosphere would increase 10 fold if gambling was allowed but appreciate this may never happen with all due respect to the country's culture and way of life.

Good experience - again - but beware of rip off taxis!. Booked the tiered restaurant for 29 January, and once again the 4 course meal was delicious and service very good, with fab views of the finishing post. However, our night was ruined when we made the mistake of being pressured by a persuasive man by the taxi rank into getting into a cream coloured cab from outside Meydan to our hotel on Ras Al Khaymah : we should've got out when we saw there was no meter :( the driver got lost at least twice and kept asking for directions, and when we finally reached our hotel, charged us an extortionate fee of 427 dirhams. Bear in mind it cost us 160 for the outward journey, this was one rip off and I'd like to warn other travellers.
Amazing place to visit.... One of the best places to visit, if one is interested in Horse racing... The whole concept of Meydan is truly exceptional....
Fantastic. Great value for money. Half the price as home. Emailed re tickets and they were there waiting. Our trip to the Races made our holiday

Best Horse Racing in the World. The Dubai Carnival is on in Q1 and what a great racecourse - more important is to go there with a group and hire a box so that you have your won private area with drinks and food served throughout the evening. With all the change sin the past few years Meydan is very easy to drive into - just make sure if you go for the box option you know which part of the car park you want to be in to cut down on walking too far. If you are visiting Dubai try and include the world famous Dubai World Cup in March the culmination of 19 days of superb horse racing

Dubai World Cup Carnival. Wonderful evening at the races in the Tiered Restaurant. Well looked after and excellent VFM. Two comments for future visitors to note:1. Dress code says ladies should wear hats - no one else did apart from our table!2. Availability of taxis at the end was very poor and the queue was long. So either pre nook a taxi or get the free shuttle bus to Dubai Mall and pick up a taxi from there.

Superb Race Course. Excellent facilities, No expense, spared Luxury. Brilliant accomerdation and amazing views of the race course, from my hotel room and the swimming pool, very helpful staff, nothing was too much trouble, food and restaurants were all exceptional, yes I will be back, next time I am in Dubai. Nice location away from the shopping areas though there is a complementary shuttle-bus, to all the malls. (Marina Mall about 20 min depending on traffic).

Excellent! . Went for the races for a friends 50th birthday and it was such a great day out. There's food and drinks everywhere, for every budget and the people watching is fantastic for all the crazy outfits and hats. Great day!

Plan your transportation & accommodation . If you do make it to Meydan to experience a race make sure to book a room at the hotel for the full experience. Meydan racecourse is located deep inside the desert so consider planning your accommodation and transportation.

A fantastic 60th birthday present. I have always been interested in horse racing , I am a fan of the goldolphin operation so to go to the meydan racecourse was a dream on my 60th birthday. My wife bought a drinks package at the tiered restaurant where we had a fabulous time had a great view of the racecourse the paddock and of course the winning post. The food and the service was absolutely first class I was presented with a fabulous cake and the staff were great a truly great birthday present that I will always remember , if in Dubai and you want to do something different you will not be disappointed.
awesome place. every thing about this place is fantastic- cant wait to go backHotel, pool, restuarants, Service Race course itself- Just Mint!

At the Meydan for business. This is an amazing place: a mile long hotel with view on the racecourse. We usually we do business events here twice per year. The staff is very supportive and every details is arranged to perfection, from the snacks to the technical support. Finally the buffet dinner has a very wide choice from Iranian to middle eastern and be sure to leave some room for dessert, although it would be difficult no to overeat, since the choice (again) is super.

World Cup Carnival Races Meydan Racecourse. Went to this venue one evening as a treat for my husband celebrating his retirement. We stayed in Dubai for two nights before boarding a cruise ship.The track is beautifully maintained , we had superb seating as we were dining at the Grandstand Restaurant. This was worth every penny and highly recommended.Service at the venue was perfect and the meal was outstanding, The restaurant can be pre booked on the Meydan website. It was a great experience for our last night in Dubai.

Great night at the races!. Before heading to the racetrack to watch the horse races, we asked around to get an idea of what to expect... Unfortunately nobody seemed to have been to the racetrack or know anything about it. They are missing out! Make sure you get the premium seating, it is definitely worth it. The place is amazing, really clean, great food and bar service, and you get freedom to go down on the grass close to the horses. We had no problems and a fantastic night! This place should definitely get more attention than it does!

Great venue. Went to the first race of the Dubai World Cup racing. Paid for ring side lounge seating for 100 AED which gave you outside seating and waiter service to your table. Great spectical although slight anticlimax in that no betting is allowed at the course with it being an Arabic country. They do provide you with a coupon on entry though where you pick the winners of each race and a cash price is on offer. Worth a visit.

Still not got it right. Very poor service, kitchens unfinished, lack of decent management, facilities unfinished, toilets smell aweful, so much potential, but it is never going to make it until they sort out the management.
State of Art Course. World Class Racecourse with excellent facilities - however there is no on course gambling there. Alcohol is served in the bars, but is quite expensive.

Waste of impressive space. This racecourse is massive and the races are empty...I'm sure the World Cup gets a larger cored but this building and the accompanying hotel is massive!!! Abandoned might be a good word, the bathrooms were dusty and looked unused. The racecourse is impressive though by size as far as desert goes. This is also away from town but a cheap 15 minute cab ride away from downtown

Stable tour. This tour operates on Tuesdays and Wednesdays see http://www.meydan.ae/equestrian/stable-tours for time and dates.If you like racing and horses - this is for you. It is led by Mark Monkhouse - the tour starts with a buffet breakfast at the hotel then a short hop to the stables. We were able to see the horses in their stalls as well as the general day to day activity of a stable. Horses being shod and bathed. We were shown their special food charts - one horse even had to do a demo on their special treadmill. We went on to see the horses' own swimming pool and then back to the racecourse to visit the course and behind the scenes in the jockeys' room. An enjoyable and interesting morning for both adults and children.The only downside is that it is not easy to book. The concierge at the hotel arranged our visit but Mark Monkhouse says the hotel is working on a new booking system which will enable potential participants to book on line.

Go for the Dubai World Cup - otherwise do not bother. Besides Ascott in the UK the Dubai World Cup has become an annual event that should be marked in your calendars not only if you are a horse enthusiast. DWC has become a focal point for socialites and business people alike and draws in more visitors year after year. The one-day event features the world's highest denoted price money, which is why every jockey that has rank and name will be represented. Other than during DWC most of the Maydan hotel is closed and besides the race track there is not really much to see.Tip: book the "Apron Views" category for DWC; it offers the best value and allows you to be immediately besides the race track for excellent views.

Racing like you have never experienced it!. Amazing. It surely beats a wet winter racing meeting in the UK! What an experience. Opt for the all inclusive tickets which have access to a great suite for viewing with an excellent four course meal and all alcoholic drinks.
brunch. Fab Friday brunch away from the busy jumeirah area!! Great food choice and quality along with attentive staff and good choices for children

Good one. Meydan hotel is bit far from the city but once you reach there & visit Racecourse, you will feel that its worth visiting this place. Make sure you have a car with you as getting taxi is very difficult task specially after late evening.

Fantastic place for watching race - avoid the expensive "stable tour". Meydan Racecourse is an impressive place to visit, especially for watching races which start from November (planning available on http://www.dubaiworldcup.com/visit/calendar/racing-calendar). Outside for the worldcup, there are good seatting areas accessible for free (but you may choose to indulge yourself a nice diner with front view).I would however not recommend the "stable tour" which is proposed by the Meydan hotel. This is very pricey and you don't get really much value for your money. You are taken in a bus tour around the infrastructure and visit one of the stable. What is really lacking is a good guide. No overall background information on the importance of the horse race for the region, how the races are organised. how horses are trained, how is the life of a jockey,...there are so many topics which could be covered during this tour. Don't expect seeing horses training either. You see them in their boxes.

People gave strange looks.... It was interesting to see how everybody were so pumped up for the race. The facility was great, you could buy food downstairs. There were big screens so you could keep track on the horses and of course you can make bets with your friends/loved ones/family. But people were giving us strange looks which made me feel like we weren't welcomed, but that's just my interpretation of it.

Well worth a look. Totally over the top - in a fun way! You won't believe your eyes at the size and the features of this place. Worth a visit just to stroll around and gaze. Don't miss the groovy lifts!
Racecourse with in the Hotel complex.. Excellent location for all horse lovers alike.Throughbreed and local horse compete each other in huge luctratic price of the evening.

Perfect viewing. Very well organized with ample parking and seating available. Clear views of the races with big screens providing all details. The lounge offers dining and up close viewing opportunities. Well worth a visit or two just for the experience and the lovely winter weather.
doing it again. wow its an amazing place to be, had a great experience there during the richest horse race in the world event as well as JLo's concert.... good times out there

Great night out. We've been 3 or 4 times including the Dubai World Cup (wouldn't recommend going to this!) on an average race night this is great fun, bit weird not having bookies which can make the racing crowd a bit more subdued, but good value for money and for a night out with friends
Christmas Day Celebrations. Just to say an absolutely fantastic day!!! Would definitely visit again, food excellent and brilliant value for money.

Lady Gaga concert. We were 4 girls who went for the Lady Gaga concert on 10th Sept, ;14. Loved the place. The seats were lit up in florescent colors and looked amazing at night. Everything was comfortable and the rest rooms were clean even though the event attracted more than 50000 guests minimum.

Brunch at the Race Course. The race course offers a wonderful setting for brunch. Use of the corridor for seating and serving slightly odd (best to ask for a table inside the restaurant. Good spread of food and entertainment for the children. Wine disappointing. Service excellent!
breath taking. colossal race course with 5 star facilities, be it the paddocks or the general area the view is spectacular

Beautiful Racetack. No expense was spared in the construction of the new Meydan Racecourse. It's modern, efficient, parking is easy and free and racing is always exciting. Sheikh Mohammed's horses are always in the running and you're just as likely to see the Ruler of Dubai mingling in the crowd or around his horse(s) as they prepare to run.

Dubai World Cup. This is one of those events not to be missed. Get in the Bubble room and let the party roll. However those who have been there before please do not give your tickets to the children or young adults outside when you are leaving in the early evening before the concert. Such incidents allowed up to 1000 people inside using those tickets and we had to stop one person stealing a friends handbag, while several bottles of Champagne in ice buckets were stolen from the intruders. This was a damper to the end of the night between 9pm-Midnight. Midday to 9pm was fantastic. Looking forward to the next world cup and hopefully security is better this time round.

Great venue. Been here a couple of times, once for the horse racing and once to see Usher and Katie Perry concert. Great venue, easy parking. The horse racing is a great evening out, even if your not interested in horses -just go and enjoy the experience...

mainly for concerts or horse racing. The main arena is good an modern. Everything around it is basically desert. The only time its open is during concerts, camel or horse races.. Nothing so grand, unless your attending an event
Meydan. Good place. It.s better to go when they have horse race so that you can see a real race between the most beautiful arabian horses.
Amazing. Had a fab time here for our friends birthday celebrations. Food very good and this race track is amazing. We booked a food and drink package and it was great value for money.

Dubai World Cup Horse race. go if u are in dubai during the race
the girls are dressed with great hats
champagne are flowing like a new year
great artists
well arranged from the locals
best race with most money in the world
just go

Visited during Dubai World Cup week. Stunning track. As a racing fan its akin to a football fan going to Wembley or a golfer playing at St Andrews. Fantastic facilities, outstanding views of the track from anywhere and first class attention to detail. I met one of the Dubai Royal Family Princes whilst there and they couldn't have been any nicer. Although bodyguards were rather scary!

Amazing amazing..... Simply put this was an enormous feat to get a 1km long race stand available in the time they did, when we visited it was only half full, but none the less more impressive.
great atmosphere, catering to all budgets.
Average. The racecourse itself was lovely.. But the atmosphere wasn't very exciting. Definatley not for children.

Evening at the Races. During the early part of the year the racecourse holds evening 'brunch type' events where you can watch the racing from the elegance of their restaurant on tiered levels so all can see the action. Very expensive to get a table here during the Gold Cup weekend so a great opportunity to eat here. Food good, not brilliant but it's the whole package that makes it worthwhile and allows you to choose horses in races (not gambling) so you get involved - great fun.

Spectacular horse racing venue. Attended the World Cup and we were impressed with everything about the event and the racecourse. Beautifully designed, amazing views, impeccable service (we were in one of the lower level sections near the finish line). Also took a tour of the racecourse, the stands and the stables a few days later and continued to be impressed. Well worth the trip and highly recommend to anyone who wants a great racing experience. The Meydan Hotel adjoining is awesome as well.
Awsome Racecourse. This is one of the world's best racecourse developed under the guidance of HH Sheikh Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum.

A Racetrack To Beat All Others!. The grandstand has to be seen to be believed - it is huge! If you think Ascot's is big, this is much bigger! I went on a public holiday to an 'everyday' meeting and the public areas were rammed, as it is free entry. However, for a much more pleasant and refined experience, pay the 150dhms to go in the Parade Ring Bar/Restaurant, where you get space, air conditioning, alcohol and excellent food. Well worth the money.

Business Function Review. I recently had the pleasure of attending a business function at the Meydan and the whole experience was delightful. Lovely views over Dubai and the Racecourse and the meal and service was wonderful.

World cup a must but with the vip package. We all paid 13oodhs for the vip package at the world cup and must say that it was worth every penny, the views were good and the food and drink was in abundance at the right times, the concert afterwards was also part of the package and great value, not to mention the racing itself (lacks a little atmosphere as no betting) however you pick 6 horses on arrival for the chance to win some great prizes.
Meydan World Cup Horseracing. Incredible. Nothing bad at all to say! Excellent atmosphere! Excellent view from the Sky Bubble lounge! Excellent service, food and drink! Brilliant!
Dubai Races. We were in connections Lounge and got a great meal and very good service. unfortunately no betting was possible but it was a great evening out.

Amazing facility, best I have ever seen for horse racing. Its an unbelieveable stadium and has great facilities. We were there for the world cup this year and really enjoyed the event. The all weather track si further away than the grass track so a little harder to see. The views from the bubble lounge is amazing both of the course and the city of Dubai. One to see a horse race at for sure.

Horse racing by floodlight. A great place to watch the horse racing almost continually whilst having dinner under the stars! The buffet was excellent and the general ambience of the hotel,racecourse and outdoor dining was an excellent and unusual experience.

ISOLATED BUT ROYAL. Its one of those places which you would curse for booking initially. This will though change very quickly as this place gets to you slowly but surely... race course is nice. Roof top swimming pool is beautiful. staff is very courteous.
Great night out. Lovely atmosphere and good views of the racing.I recommend this for small groups to go and have a flutter and some fun.
Beautiful. We attended the dubai world cup here, very well made and a real treat, parking was very organised , i recommend to all
Awestruck. AwestruckWe had lots of fun at the Apron Views and what an experience it was at the concert after .Seeing J-Lo perform, such a Delight.

So we landed here, and coincidentally the world cup was on.. Friend of mine said, "lets go to the Dubai World Cup" upon landing in Dubai.Not knowing what we got ourselves into, a yes was given. Now this is how you entertain!!! amazing diversity, with different areas for different Punters. We had all access and check out the pictures!Fireworks. Drinks. Sheiks.And apparently there was a horse race somewhere. I imagine the hotel attached to this would be quite good :)You could eat your food off the floor if you were that way inclined it is that clean.

Good restaurant at the Meydan racecourse Hotel. The view is amazing and the food is tasty with a lot of variety. The buffet is worth it. The service is very good and very friendly. In fact I have been there twice now and would love to go more times

Executive Housekeeper. The hotel is one of the best we have stayed at. It felt exclusive and the facilities matched this most of the time. The room 703 were the biggest & room very clean and the best layed out I have ever stayed in and the food/breakfast was great at the Z Everyone in the hotel was also very helpful and always deal with a smile. Thank you, Narendra.

Going to the Races. Meydan racecourse is a great place to watch horse racing. Apart from World Cup day the prices are cheap and the stadium is state of the art and very clean. Food and drink are easily available and not too expensive by Dubai standards. Wide range of options are available from fully catered meals to casual fast food style. the only down side is that there is not betting on course due to the local laws.

great night at the races. Second year running and another spectacular night at the races.We upgraded this year to premium1 and loved it , will definately be rebooking the same for next year.The food and drink on the all inclusive was pretty special, was not expecting it to be as good, although everything in Dubai is done on a grand scale.Cant wait for next year.

A must do if you are interested in horses at all!. Loved the stable tour - seeing the horses and their daily regime. Grand stand is amazing as is the magilis. Went on the stable tour last year but this year the tours were finished when we went so had the afternoon tea in the hotel overlooking the racetrack - what a view! The afternoon tea was superb - way too much to eat but what a relaxing way to spend an afternoon!
Atelier Festival. Visited Meydan a few times, but primarily for Atelier music festival. Very well organised, absolutely spectacular night of fun and great music. Well worth it!

Great day out. It was my first time coming to Meydan an what a perfect time i chose to visit for the Dubai World Cup. There was a group of 40 of us and what a day we had! Unfortuunetly we purchased our tickets too late and was not able to dine there. However we had great view of J-Lo perfoming and spent the majority of the day in the Moet stand. The only thing i missed was the atmosphere compared to the Grand National in Aintree in the UK. However we did make the most of it and would only probably ever come again for another big event!

Bit dull !?. I was holidaying in Dubai February this year and as we enjoy horse racing in UK & Ireland we decided to get glammed up & go to the evening racing here, went for the hospitality package, badges, dinner, drinks VIP - was lovely. Though we found the racing sedated & races over very quickly - no real atmosphere or excitement amongst the hospitality suites or crowd below !Though was a lovely experience & evening ☺️

Fantastic evening!. We went to the races to have dinner in the tiered restaurant, it was perfect! Such a lovely view overlooking the course and the winning post. The evening went very quickly and was very relaxed. The service received from our waitress was perfect. Lovely food, lovely company and a perfect setting! A night to remember !
Meydan Racecourse. By far the best racecourse in the worldThe Dubai World Cup night is a spectacle to beholdOnly fault is the traffic control before and after racing, needs to be addressed

'' High Tea ''. Been to this place more than once but the afternoon tea is always consistent... stayed for the sunset with a glass of bubbly on the lobby terrace..the view of the race track and neighboring green areas is something that makes one think you are in one of the tropical places in another country.

a world class racecourse. i was there recently for the dubai world cup. the racecourse is among the finest i have seen. the world cup day was spectacular, with a grand fireworks display and a jenniffer lopez concert at the end.the facilities are top class,public transport. was adequate, with a bus service on world cup day, taking you to the dubai mall metro stop, which is fairly central.

Horse bling to the max. I do not like horse racing one bit. However, I do like to people watching, drinking and having fun with friends. This is a blast for all of that. This event is very Dubai. Over the top and maxed out on bling and people showing off their wealth. What a blast. If you are going to go, make sure you go with a group of friends to make the most of it.
World Cup Day. Brilliant venue, very similar to Ascot, but on a bigger scale. The firework displays were fantastic, a great days racing. Finished off with a Jennifer Lopez concert. Great

Veni Vidi but no Vici. We had a Brunch at El Meydan. At the end we walked outside to see el Meydan. The brunch was good and the race track unfortunately was just empty. Saw I came I saw but did not witness a race.The green is beautiful in this landmark.To get there you can be lost if you don tknow your way.

Magi meydan. This was the reason we went to Dubai and we were not disappointed. Got there for the gates opening at 1400 and what a day/night we had. We got our picture taken as we went in and yes we bought it (well you have to don't you lol) lovely memento. As it started to fill in the atmosphere was fantastic everyone chatted, laughed, mingled, and cheered. This is the place to people watch the ladies with their gorgeous dresses and big hats, and big heels (bare feet later on ) drink was quite dear about £6 a bottle of beer, but hey it's only once a year. Food was fine we didn't go for a fancy meal pizza did us. Just before the big race the lights dimmed and the music show with fireworks began.....loved it. Then the World Cup race and then Jennifer Lopez to end a fantastic night. Kinda organized chaos afterwards getting a taxi but we managed.....All in all we had a fantastic time and so glad we were there. :-)

Super Saturday. A first class facility with great racing action. We visited on Super Saturday and had an excellent time. We got tickets in the Parade Ring Lounge and were up close and personal with the horses and all the action. Great service surrounded by great action and wonderful people.

Amazing Racecourse. We went to the tiered restaurant and had an amazing meal while having a great view of the racecourse. The building itself is amazing, its worth going just to see the grandstand. Entry to the main stands are free.For a country that aren't allowed to gamble, it has a great atmosphere and every one is cheering at the finish line. There is a free bus that takes you back to the main town for free at the end of the night, but if looking for a quick exit, there are plenty of taxis, and they are cheap.

Another venue with no traffic engineering. We went this past Saturday to the races. After being in Dubai for 9 years, when we received an invitation from Emirates, we decided to go.Firstly getting there is a disaster. The same road is used once taxi's drop you off, so no traffic engineering or forethought has gone into the design. Getting out is another story...The food quality at the Emirates hospitality tent is appalling and if this is showcasing what they can do, they are doing themselves a huge disservice.Food is served on plastic plates and drinks in plastic cups, this is the world's richest horse race, premiere occasion and everyone dressed up, eating as if you are in a fast food court in Al Quoz.All in all a terrible day and waste of time.

World's best architectural beauty. I am lucky and fortunate to ba a part of the Meydan team while this was developed from March 2007 and culminated in March 2010 to be presented to the world by HH Sheikh Mohammed Bin Rashid, you must visit this while visitng United Arab Emirates (Dubai/Abu Dhabi), the bubble lounge restaurant, the world's longest grandstand with marina, world's largest LED screen, only dual equine racetrack (turf and synthetic), largest carpark (shape based on national bird falcon), the crescent roof with LED lights, everything came alive from our visionary leader's dream. The five star Meydan hotel is adjacent, with IMAX theatre.

Expensive, glamorous, pretentious. Dress up to the nines, socialize and drink! - Arguably one of the best days out in Dubai. We were in the Apron Views section; Moët Chandon area. It's expensive: 320AED entry plus 600AED minimum per bottle of champagne. Wish there were healthier food options. LOVED JLo as the after race entertainment! Advice for ladies: wear comfortable shoes!!!

World Cup 2014. A wonderful venue, however, starting to fray at the edges. We purchased a Sky Bubble ticket which is a function area at the very top of the grandstand, comprising 3 floors. Due to poor ticket sales only part of the 7th floor was turned into a function area with food and beverages. This was quickly swamped by ex pats who tucked in to the unlimited alcohol and soon lost interest in the races and went into party mode. The next two higher floors were empty and there were some spare chairs, so we and a handful of others , went up there, enjoyed relative peace while watching the races. The trouble with the Sky Bubble is it has a massive structural steel triangular lattice to support the glazing, which obstructs the view markedly. Also there are no outdoor balconies so you miss the noise and excitement of the race. In the end we ended up in the general public area, trackside on the grass and enjoyed ourselves much more. The general cleanliness of the Sky Bubble area was poor with door handles missing on external doors, filthy toilets on floor 8 and dirty glazing. Nowhere near the crowd of Flemington on a Melbourne Cup, considering the prize money on offer.

Great organization of Dubai Horserace world cup. As we attend every year this special annual world cup , such a great organization from arrival with huge parking space availability , guidance on the way to reach hotel where the race taking place , in the premium lounge where we were booked a lavish buffet and open bar were inclusive ,direct access to grass field just few meters away from the race track where the horses passing is given to guests of this area which is great , as the tradition with such events everyone super dressed up and ladies decorating their heads with the different colorful hats making this event such a joy and fun ! we will be back again next year for sure ! only wish if event could be held on Friday instead of Saturday as next day is working day but understanding that many guests and organizers come for a weekend from Europe and around the world . keep up.

a touch of england in the middle east.... want to get all geared up and have an eccentric hat and fab outfit ladies? I sipped orange juice but champagne is flowing and the horses are so beautiful definitely something to see... I find the fauna of the crowd more interesting than the horses, as individualism is at its best! but love the horses ...
magical meydan. we went to teirs restaurant with a fab view and top class service. great food and drink and very glamorous! will definately be going again.

5 Star 5 Star 5 Star Wonderful. Upon arrival the grandure of this place just amazes you, We had tickets for the parade ring & lounge area and it was simply exquisite, Very luxurious, very nice reasonable priced food available, Alcohol served, Stella was £8 a pint.
