The facilities, the staff, the pick 6 ticket was alot of fun, you could even win a car on the night, I could not fault anything about this place, Simply amazing cant wait to go back, will try the tiered all in restaurant next time, A nice place to get dressed up, have a lovely evening, taxis as always cheap & plentiful.

Top notch evening. We were in Dubai and it coincided with a race night Thursday 13th March the last race of the season before the gold cup. we booked in advance online tickets for silks including food and drink. We arrived at around 6pm and were shown to our table with a glass of prosecco. There was an outside balcony area offering seats and view over the racecourse. From that moment on the drinks were flowing and the service was fantastic whenever your glass looked empty another was brought from the great selection offer. The food was great and such a choice. Loads of shellfish within the starters. A carvery of beef was also available. You could just graze all evening. The racing was a great thing to see. We had a great eveing and would return. Taxis were easy to get afterwards outside.
A sense of brotherhood. Leaders are identified by humanity and vision. On behalf Meydan can find. humanity, vision, hospitality, sports and whatever you want.

Fantastic value and night. This was our first night on our trip and we only managed a 2 hour sleep before going having been up pretty much 28 hours. We thought it was going to be a struggle truth be told. Taxi from JBR was £13 including tip which is pretty amazing considering the distance covered. Same trip back home would easily be £50. It's a wonderful setting from the outside and reminded me a lot of Ascot back home. I had bought tickets for Silks restaurant with free alcohol for about £70 which turned out to be the best value ever. From the moment we arrived at 6pm to the minute we left at 10pm, our glasses were topped up constantly with lovely Prosecco. The views from our table looking over the course were magnificent and we could sit outside for each race and still be topped up. The good was exquisite. Glorious. Amazing. Fantastic. Many other ways to define excellent. Great variety and felt more gourmet than buffet. Constantly refreshed and heated perfectly as well. The guys were really helpful when puting on the pick 6 and tricasts etc and whilst we didn't win any of the big prizes on offer, it was good to have the chance without paying a single penny......or dirham.... as it's free to enter. When leaving there were plenty of taxis and we got back to our hotel very sharp. An excellent experience and one I would urge all to do if lucky enough to be here when racing is on.
A nice view and nice lounge to chill at.. A nice view and nice lounge to chill at while catching a horse race at the same time. It is a huge venue. Service was a bit slow and under staffed.

Beautiful, Fun, and Free. We were lucky enough to make it to a race during our stay in Dubai. General admission is free to anyone, just be aware that they don't sell alcohol or food. The Meydan is stunning, and the horses are beautiful. The building is worth going in itself. After a couple of races, we had drinks at the connected bar, Qube, and watched the final race and people watch (including the jockeys). Next time, I think we'll opt for getting into one of the boxes.

What a great night out.. This has to be the best value night out in Dubai. We paid around £80 per head for the tiered restaurant which included a fabulous four course meal, alcoholic drinks and the racing entertainment. The views were spectacular and you could just about drink the cost in wine alone (at Dubai wine prices). The best meal and night out possible in Dubai.

Fabulous evening's racing. With two nights to spend in Dubai we were so lucky that there was racing at Meydan. It was one of the best evenings I have experienced ever. We booked tickets for the Silks restaurant before we left the UK. On arrival at the racecourse we were transported to the ticket collection office where our tickets were in our hands with one minute. No queuing or waiting for them to be found. Once in the restaurant the views of the course were amazing and my husband and I upgraded our tickets so that we could have some drinks with the delightful buffet which ran all evening. The staff looked after us very well indeed especially the young man from Nepal (I am sorry I don't have his name).The racing was magnificent - all the horses were top class. Sheik Mohammed has really built a first class venue. Ascot and other top English courses could learn many lessons from Meydan. Brilliant.

Fantastic Meydan. My wife and I visited on 6 February and I satisfied a long term dream to visit the track. We did the tiered restaurant package with drinks at £75 each and I can not fault anything . Our table at the lowest level was immediately above the combined parade / winners enclosure. We had a super view of the finish and the large screens are the largest I have seen at any event. We enjoyed smoked duck breast followed by lamb shank or a fish dish followed by cheese and biscuits. The accompanying wines were enjoyable too. We had almost exclusive service from a relatively new Indian waitress and she did a wonderful job throughout. Every member of staff we encountered was a credit to Meydan.Top tip is the first race is not usually included in the six to follow!Top tip two is allow 30 minutes in aCar from Dubai MallOur taxi was able to drop us off and collect us without delay but there was not a full house.

Fantastic Night. Went to Meydan Racecourse with a friends.There is ample parking and it is easy to get into the track. Once inside, I was greeted by helpful staff. My friends and I were in the Premier Section, but even the free areas appear to be well maintained, clean, and it is easy to see the track.There is are several venues for eating and the prices are reasonable. The food and drink are good quality and staff members will bring your orders directly to your seat. The stands allow for easy viewing of the race action as well as the pre race activities. There is also the opportunity to win prize money and everyone is allowed to participate and the picks are explained prior to the start of the first race. This is truly a nice place to spend an evening and the facility is first class. I highly recommend a visit to the racecourse for a fun evening with family, friends, and it is kid friendly.

amazing. booked silks.the food drinks service were beyond reproach.only passed ayr racecourse today 08 /02 /2014 and the billboard stated hospitallity started from £125 idon`t think so! time they woke up and smelt the coffee.
good night out. great value compared to UK racing . Lovely food and the entertainment was fab ! The only down side was the taxi wait was abit long.

everything is 5 star. Went last year at "Carnival" time & could'nt wait to get back.if you can then you must go for the tiered restaurant.4 course meal, all the wine you can drink overlooking the parade ring & winners enclosure & of course the track.Huge wide screens right opposite.If you like your racing then this is the best £75 you will ever spend.Excellent quality of racing which encourages a lot of the top jocks from Britain to "winter"Try getting this value in U K , absolutely impossible

For the free racing but it was excellent - will go again & even pay!. After a year in Dubai we finally made it to Meydan racecourse. Entry was free and there were 6 races on the card. It included some top jockeys like Fallon & Dettori.... Food was very reasonable & plenty of seats in the Grandstand. It was Chinese New Year so between races there was even entertainment on the stage. All in all a good night out...(racing starts at 18:30 due to the heat).

MEYDAN REVISITED. I visited Meydan in January 2012, and booked seats in The Tiered Restaurant - a wonderful experience. My family in Dubai have been to (I think) Silks, again a good experienceThis month I revisited to take advantage of the free entry, and to admire a 5.5 furlong stand. There was good quality racing, a Listed Race, but no Group Races, but under the floodlights and the all weather track being so far away, we might just as well have been at Wolverhampton!The catering is a choice of franchised outlets; I hate McDonalds and KFC, but they would have been welcome. The Red Carpet Restaurant stall was particularly virulent.I love racing; I do not bet so that was not a problem; I like a drink on course but that is not available in the public enclosure. the race cards (free) did not list the officialsIf you like racing go to one of the better enclosures and have a good night outIf you want to take a look at the free enclosure, take your own picnic and a hip flask.I look forward to being back at Bangor soon. On a long holiday, I also went racing in Bangkok and Motokurara - I hope to report, but Tripadvisor cannot recognise them!Enjoy your racing on holiday!

Excellent Facility. I had the pleasure of attending the horse racing at the Meydan Racecourse and was impressed with the facility. There is ample parking and it is easy to get into the track. Once inside, I was greeted by helpful staff. My party and I were in the Premier Section, but even the free areas appear to be well maintained, clean, and it is easy to see the track. There is are several venues for eating and the prices are reasonable. The food and drink are good quality and staff members will bring your orders directly to your seat. The stands allow for easy viewing of the race action as well as the pre race activities. There is also the opportunity to win prize money and everyone is allowed to participate and the picks are explained prior to the start of the first race. This is truly a nice place to spend an evening and the facility is first class. I highly recommend a visit to the racecourse for a fun evening with family, friends, and it is kid friendly.

Beautiful race course. Here horses are treated better than many human beings, in their training facilities!!The race course is built with the all weather material, which protects horses from getting injured.A very glamourous event is the DUBAI WORLD CUP, every March. The richest Horse race in the world, due to the horses value and prize given (10m USD)

Fantastic. We had an enjoyable night of Racing after purchasing a ticket with a view of the winners enclosure No winners but a good evening. Not very busy I'm sure that will improve closer to the Carnival

Dubai World Cup,. Nothing suits Dubai like the Dubai World Cup.Being the Worlds richest Horse Race, the World cup entices all lovers of horse racing together. From the entertainment, the racing, seeing the best jockeys in the world and the whole ambiance all in one.If your in town during the end of March, you have to book your tickets early and experience a one in a life time day at the races.

Fantastic Horse Racing. The racing in Meydan is a fantastic way to spend some quality time watching some of the worlds best horses. They have different levels of tickets including fee tickets, but I suggest buying parade ring passes. you get up close to the horses, see the jockeys and trainers.Love going to Meydan races.

Fabulous experience. What an amazing race course the stand is fantastic and looks stunning at night which us when we went. Staff here are brilliant and we were taken to the entrance by golf buggy to buy our tickets and then dropped off at the entrance loved it!

Pleasant venue.. Visited 2nd Jan so not Dubai World Cup but still good evening. Entry free and seating on ground level plus level 1 and 2. We didn't book for tiered restaurant which I am sure is a great experience. Food Hall was typical fast food with lots if kids about. Not quite racing experience I am used to but a pleasant way to spend the evening.

Meydan Golf Course. There is a 9 hole Golf Course along side the RaceCourse that we played. It was good value and the course was in very good condition. Not too expensive and a soft drink and Burger was part of the deal in the excellent clubhouse. As with most Courses in Dubai Driving Range, buggies with ice filled coolers congaing bottles of water are all part of the deal. As dusk drew close on came the floodlights so play continued

First meeting of the season. Meydan on a "standard" evening's racing is Ascot without the attitude; Churchill Downs without the crowds; Flemington without the Fosters; Longchamp without the "louche". In other words its a world class racing venue with a true soul. Strange to be somewhere where gambling is not permitted but there is a free to enter competition. At the bargain basement end is free admission but we went for broke and reserved a table in the pay-and-view "Tiered" restaurant. A choice of 2 starters, 2 mains and dessert plus wines and other alcoholic drinks for 450 dirhams for the pair of us - excellent views, excellent food and excellent value. To be fair this was the first meeting of the season so there were a few glitches with the service but nothing that spoiled the overall enjoyment of the evening. As a first time visitor there are a couple of tips we have noted:The first race for most evening meetings is at 6.30pm which coincides with some of Dubai's worst traffic jams so factor in plenty of time to get to the course.If booking tickets on line they can be easily collected on the evening from the ticket office this avoiding any risk of postage / additional costs.Anyone keen on racing visiting Dubai during the "season" should make an evening at Meydan a MUST!

Nice 9 hole course.. The course is well presented with some challenging holes. The clubhouse is modern and has a restaurant and sports bar. You can play in the evening as it is floodlit. Very enjoyable visit.

Races , good resturants and nice place to stay iin. I love races .. But when i visited it was off season so i enjoy the beautiful hotel and good resturante ..
I really love the design of Mydan . You can watch the race from you hotel room or from the launges

Not just a racecourse. Within the confines of the Meydan estate and dwarfed by the fabulous racecourse grandstand, lies the nearest thing to a public golf course that you can experience in the UAE. A challenging nine hole spread of a superbly maintained and managed golf course with all of the facilities that any social or competitive golfer could possibly want. Fully floodlit to accommodate golf at all hours, The Track Golf Course at Meydan is a very pleasant and welcoming establishment, and it was no surprise to see that Troon Golf - possibly the best golf facility management company around - were responsible for the day to day organisation. After the golf, the QUBE Sports Bar lives up to all of the other top quality features that the Meydan Estate has to offer. Definitely a 'must return to' on my next Dubai visit.

Incredible experience. My husband is really into racing and has visited many racecourses and this is the best by far! Track and grandstand are really fantastic. Even if you don't like the racing you will be impressed by this beautiful building. The staff at really friendly and were happy to go the extra mile. Although there was no racing on whilst we were there, we had a great time and got to see some of the horses. Will definitely be back.

Out of this world. The racecourse is amazing, we went to the Dubai World Cup 2012 and it was the most incredible experience I have ever had. The vast size of the place and the atmosphere was out of this world.
Stunning venue. Besides the gorgeous horse racing track and grounds, there's really nothing going on here BUT if you are a fan of architecture, landscaping, and horses, this is a must visit.

Great day/night out. This massive event lives up to the hype! The atmosphere is fantastic and everyone makes a great effort on the day. Not being to actually bet at the venue is bizarre but easy to circumvent. Overall, the overriding feeling is one of enjoyment and that people are there to have a good time (which is not always the case at other Asian race courses). Delighted to have gone and would go back in a minute.

Races and happy Faces. Was there during the World Cup...what an atmosphere with the racing under the most brilliant floodlights....the presence of the reigning Sheikh and family just added that pazaz to the whole deal! Great!

Amazing visit for racing fans. Went here on the first evening of the 2012 / 13 season . I am a huge racing fan and always wanted to see this magnificent venue . I was not dissapointed it was fantastic . On arrival your photo is taken with a track backdrop a lovely souvenir to have and not to expensive. Food and drinks available at reasonable prices for dubai and a great night out.

Don't miss it. We were lucky just to arrive in Dubai to see the World Cup. Don't miss the opportunity to see the world greatest horse race. The racetrack is than everything in Dubai big and beautiful. You can see the best racehorses during an evening. The opening ceremony is amazing

Meydan The Track Golf Course. Had the pleasure of recently playing the Meydan The Track golf course, and enjoyed every minute of it, was great value at 222DHS which included range balls and cart hire, will be playing there again asap.

World class. World class facilities...world class jockeys world class horses....all big rollers...pay a visit during the dubai gold cup to experience the amazing meydan....keep an eye on the calendar for the dubai gold cup...

Dubai world Cup 2013. We were very excited to attend our first Dubai World cup last Saturday March 30, 2013. Dubai world cup is the richest thoroughbred horserace with a total combination prize of $27.25 million of 9 races. The last rase being the world cup race prize was $10million.13 countries participated at the event. 10 -16 horses participated in each race. The race is held annually at the last saturday of March at Meydan racecourse . We arrived at 5 pm, doors had been open at 2.00 p.m and the first race had started at 4.30. As we were pulling in to the parking lot we waited inline for a good 20 minutes. They had public parking a little away from the racecourse . They had shuttle buses transporting ppl from the parking lot to the racecourse. It was timely and very organized. Tikets ranged from 25 AED - 3500 AED. We bought our tickets a few days ahead of time from the Meydan ticket office as we were told tickets will not be sold at the gate the day of the race.Surprisingly most of the high priced tickets were sold out only the 1200 AED and the 350 AED tickets were available. The difference was 1200 had drinks / food included and the 350 did not. However there were a few restaurants on the 1st floor. The Meydan racecourse is very impressive, takes your breath away at first glance. Having been open just 3 years a go, It is a modern racecourse with a majestic grand stand that accommodates 60 thousand spectators. Ladies were dressed to impress. Some made some serious fashion statement with outrageous hats and accessories. It was truly fun to see all the fashion hits and misses, certainly fashion police would have had a field day. There were some awards for the best dressed lady, best dressed man and best dressed couple. The ambiance was truly wonderful and relaxing. Nice weather, great entreatment, a fun place to socialize with friends.Between the races there were a few entreatments such as beautiful fireworks and very impressive acrobatic airplane shows. There were 9 horse races the last one being the big money race. I was rooting for the US based horses such as Royal Delta and Animal kingdom. I was so trilled to see 'Animal Kingdom' win the $10million race. This 5 year old thoroughbred race horse was pulled out of races in 2012 due to leg injury. It was so wonderful to see him win this race by an impressive two lengths. What a comeback !!After the award ceremony the celebration continued with an amazing solo concert of Seal . The concert was an icing on the cake ! excellent show. Seal was amazing as usual. Unfortunately we did not stay till the end of the concert as we had a flight to catch in a few hours.We thoroughly enjoyed this event. I highly recommend it. If we are in Dubai during the next world cup we will definitely attend.A few suggestions - The duration of the event is a good 10 hours. There will be a lot of drinking . I suggest to take a taxi home/ hotel. It is safe and saves you time from the parking long line.Dress fashionably but tastefully. Avoid too reviling dresses as it is offensive to the coulter. Keep in mind betting is not permitted in Dubai but world cup races are widely available for betting in the US. It is truly a glamorous and fun event. A must attend if in Dubai during the event.Enjoy!!

World Cup. Excellent day at the World Cup. Layout to watch the race and facilities are good. Few points to be mindful off.Queues to the ladies - are about the longest I've ever seen. Admittedly it's a bit race, but happens every year and not sure what it's like inbetween, but the queues where back down the corridor. Fast food area - extremely slow. Waited for nearly an hour at the chicken stall (which looked to be the fastest queue). So time it here wisely.Taxi's - forget it. We gave up and got a bus to Emirates Mall and then made our way in a taxi from there. Friends told us the next day they waited nearly 2hours for a taxi, so staying later and the shuttle bus option proved to be a wise move, even though it seemed crazy slow at the time.Though the race and atmosphere itself while there is brilliant. And all the above aside, I would go again. Just make sure some plans b and even c are made in advance :)Enjoy

Great spot. I am a regular at Meydan racing track, but its more than that. Some great restaurants and great bars.I recommend the Qube bar...great craic and great staff. Ask for Brenton when you are there. Will gladly show you around.

A Day @ the Races. Well laid out and organised..plenty of space, opportunities for dining, however the ladies bathrooms on the ground floor need to be better signposted. There were 50+ desperate ladies waiting to use the toilets on the level opposite the food court, when they one directly underneath were empty.The only dampenere on an otherwise fantastic day out. Next time will explore all the other amenities Meydan has to offer.

World cup.. What a farce!! Unorganised chaos.. Never again. Attended World Cup 2013 at Meydan.. With group of friends.. What a disappointment.. Tickets for apron views which was fine, nice views close to bars but NO seating.. Very small area of tables and chairs not sufficient for number of guests.. Had to stand all day in heels. Not a nice experience .. Food court .. What a shambles! Queues for tasteless dry chicken or pizza we wired 90 minutes for 3 pizzas!! Trying to get drinks from bar.. 20 to 30 minutes.. another useless poorly organised event.. meydan F & B manager should be ashamed. ..... Bathrooms! Ladies forget it unless you want to queue for 40 mins?? Very few toilets for apron views, Irish village area absolute bloody disgrace!! meydan wake up! You're selling drinks ( slowly) people need to pee.. . So many ladies complaining about lack of toilets... Oh the buses to get to car park after event.. What a complete and utter mess. No signs, no actual bus stops and people running after buses all over the roads.. Complete shambles ... Police directing traffic & buses but to where?? Nobody directing people to buses or organising anything! Could not actually believe what a mess it was.. Who was in charge of transport?? needs to wake up.. Totally horrid end to an already average day..

A royal treat. We went for one of the early World Cup weekend race days and had a great time. Good atmosphere, with an opportunity to see the UAE royalty. If you want to eat well pre-book a Metdan restaurant as the booth food is distinctly average.
great race course forget about the food. We had a great night at the races, great views, staff were friendly but the food in Silks was not worth the money, wouldn't bother again

Interesting. Even if you are not interested in horses it is a great place! Just go to Meydan Hotel for a cup of tea on the terrace, enjoy the park, the beautiful view, the fantastic architecture and the lovely cup of tea!

Tiered Restaurant - fantastic views, food and night. We booked a set menu package at the Tiered restaurant. Every table had a fantastic view of the course and we were lucky to be in the middle so excellent view of the paddock and finishing line. We had a lucky six draw card to fill our before going to the restaurant so had some fun checking our horses against the entry. The food was excellent, 2 choices of starter, main and dessert plus 2 choices of white and red wine. Staff were excellent and very attentive, also asking when you wanted the next course to be served.

Amazing experience. We booked a package at the tiered restaurant for the Thursday night racing. What an amazing racecourse! Our table was overlooking the parade ring and very close to the finishing line. The view was spectacular. The whole atmosphere of the place was fantastic and on being shown our table we were given both the food and drinks menu. The food was excellent & much better than expected and drinks all very good brands (you could drink Remy Martin cognac all night if the mood took you!). The service was impeccable with drinks constantly being topped up & we were asked if we were ready to accept each course. Although not regular racegoers we thoroughly enjoyed the race programme & were excited to have the opportunity to watch Kieron Fallon race! The super six competition is a great way to get involved in the absence of gambling. We would thoroughly recommend this night out and fully intend to repeat the experience on our next trip to Dubai.

I love this place!. We have visited the Racing Carnival every year since the old days at Nad Al Sheba. At Meydan, we always go to the panoramic restaurant. It was initially "finding its feet" but gets better every year and the food quality and level of service this year was truly outstanding.Great views of the course although getting down to the paddock takes a while but it definitely makes a great night out. Highly recommended!

Fantastic Night - A Must. On our visit to Dubai we decided to visit Meydan Racecourse for one of the Thursday night Dubai Racing Carnival series races after reading reviews here.We booked the Tiered Restaurant which was 450AED pp which includes house alcoholic beverages as well as a 3/4 course set menu. The views are brilliant onto the racecourse which gave you a clear view of the paddock as well as the track. Standard entry is about 25AED pp which gives you limited access in building but can go out by track.There is 6 races each Thursday night and you can book online which we did from the UK. Taxi out to Meydan was about 40AED and 30mins from our hotel in Bur Dubai area. There is no betting allowed which we forgot as Dubai is in a Muslim country, in which betting is illegal. This brings a weird twist to going to the horses. There is however a scorecard system in operation which is free, thus no betting. The card has the six races on it and you choose the horse against your program which is provided in each race and management take the body of the card away leaving you the counterfoil. I am unsure what the winning prize is as we were useless at picking the winning horses that night. The food is exquisite and the staff are very tentative to all your needs. There is a waitress/ waiter for ever two tables. We had a fantastic night and I would highly recommend a visit to the racecourse on your visit to Dubai.

My Father owns and loves Race Horses!. Two years ago, I had my father over from Vancouver, Canada. One of the favorite things we did together while he was here for one month is visit and watch the racing, we were able to make it to three race night out of four! I think he felt this was one of the best places (venue) for horse racing in the World and he's been to many of the other well know tracks World wide. All I can say is if your here in Dubai during race season then it is worth a trip and have a wonderful evening out with either family or friends to Maydan.

The worst Golf club ever. This is simply the worst golf course of the UAE. For the same price you can get a lot better. When you get there, you do not know if you are in a parking or in a golf club. Rates are very expensive. The golf carts are the worst of the UAE. Go and spend your money somerewhere else...

Meydan Horse Racing, can't miss it !. We (My husband, Kids and I) were so lucky to had chances to watch the horse race whilst we're here, in Dubai. One of the most pretigeous horse race in the world. My daughter is crazy about horse and the racing, this is how we got to visit some of the horse race, either when it was still in Nad Al Sheeba and now in Meydan. Of course we did not go every weekend (usually on Thursday night). We always had a good time there, watching the racing along with the nice dinner at the suite or the restaurant, was wonderful.

Amazing track!. The horse racing season is only a few months a year, and then only on certain days of the week, on Thursdays and then maybe on one day on the weekend. We got the paddock passes which allowed us to roam freely for the most part. There is a hotel there also and if you stay at the hotel, I believe you can get a room with a balcony that overlooks the track. We stayed and had dinner at a lovely restaurant there on the ground floor by the paddock. The food was DELICIOUS and reasonably priced. There is no betting there, of course, but the races were fun to watch regardless. There are gift shops there so you can get a nice memento, but the prices are crazy high. It was a GREAT time at a GREAT facility.

Best night of our holiday. We booked a table in the Tiered Restaurant for the last night of our 5 day trip and I can honestly say it was the absolute high point. My boyfriend is a racing journalist and I'm a keen race-goer so we were both looking forward to the actual racing but the hospitality was second to none. The price of the tickets for two worked out at less than £160 and for that we had a delicious 4 course dinner and unlimited alcoholic drinks for the evening as well as having the best seats in the house. Getting out the taxi, the course certainly has the wow factor and once we got up to the restaurant it was equally as impressive. Huge floor to ceiling windows gave uninterrupted views over the course and our table directly overlooked the parade ring and has an excellent view of the finish line.All the staff were super helpful and friendly and nothing was too much trouble, lots of photo taking!!!The meal was delicious, and spaced over the evening so you could enjoy the racing between courses. It was a very different experience to racing in the UK due to the lack of betting but the "pick 6" competition they run did give an element of excitement to proceedings.Overall though I can't recommend the experience enough, it was excellent value for money, completely fabulous and racing in England will never be the same again now I've experience it Dubai style.

Meydan Golf The Track. Apologies to horse racing fans as this is mostly about the golf facilities.Having been a fan of the original Nad Al Sheeba facilities including the golf club I was disappointed with the new 'Track' facility that has been built around what remained of the old course. The grass quality is poor and patchy, on the occasion we plaid two holes floodlights were out and the signage around the course is so small and unlit it doesnt make finding your way easy. For the same cost there is the lovely Faldo course at the Emirates course.On a positive the track is amazing as is the grandstand it will be even better maybe world class when it is all finished lots of loose ends everywhere.

Brilliant racecourse!. We visited on 10.01.13 and had an amazing evening. We ate in The Tier restaurant which was excellent, brilliant food and service at a very good price in comparison with racecourses around England. The racing was enjoyable and I would recommend visiting even if your not a racing fan as its an unforgettable experience.

While in Dubai you have to visit Meydan Racecourse. We booked the restaurant package online for the Tiered restaurant, which included entrance fee, a delicious 4 course meal and alcoholic drinks for £80 each - and it was well worth it. Easy transaction where you just show your printed confirmation at the ticket office and they give you your badges and racing pack. Waiter service at a lovely table overlooking the finishing post, with stunning views across the course and what an atmosphere. It was all very well organised with excellent service: we will be back.

Fantastic Structure. This race course is streets ahead of any other racecourse in the world. However the infastructure is lacking, massive car parks but bad traffic jams, taxi ranks, everybody seems to jump the lines. Restaurants everywhere but food leaves alot to be desired.Best thing to do is buy a cheap seat, which is great value for money, watch the races and bring your own food oh and arrange for a car hire or taxi to pick you up at a pre-determined spot, then you will have a great time. Also, try going to the weekday races which is less cowded.

Fantastic night what. Great venue. We booked to go racing here whilst still in the uk and I have to say we really was not disappointed. We booked the meal & drink package in the tiered restaurant and was had a fantastic night The food was very good the drink was served throughout without us needing to ask for it. And the racing was just exceptional! We was seated so we could see the winning line easily. The track is simply beautiful We had a fantastic evening from beginning to end. Say didn't win on the pick 6. It we didn't care as the night was extremely good.

The World Cup. The atmosphere, the electrifying positivity in the air - Dubai out does itself every year. It seems like one big party, celeb watching and dressing up to the hilt all a part of it. Event not to be missed.

A Great Night at the Races!. I took visitors to the first race meeting of the new season last Thursday (8th November) and had booked dinner at the Tiers Restaurant. We had a wonderful evening. The racing was fun and we each had a go at the 'Pick Six' free competition. The restaurant was excellent. The ambience was modern, but very stylish. The food, drinks and service were first class. And the view of the parade ring and race course was outstanding. The full length windows were right above the parade ring and opposite the winning post. Couldn't have been better.Everything at the race course was well organised and all staff were very courteous. Overall, a wonderful evening.

Fur Coat and no knickers!. 2012 world cup, we paid for the 1200aed tickets for VIP seating and all inclusive (food and drinks). This is no means the most expensive package but never the less not cheap. We should have gone with the 300aed seats.The food was inedible, cheap and poor quality and variety. Dried out spring roles, sad sandwiches and rock hard scones served on plastic plates in a canteen.The drinks available were limited and again poor quality... for 200 pounds I would expect more.The seat area was quiet, no atmoshere and this was only made worse by the death of 2 horses, one in the first race. I know this cannot be helped but all in all this was the most expensive and disapointing day we have ever had in Dubai. In total almost 3,000aed for my and I which we could have used to go to Oman or anywhere for a weekend away.

Amazing Day Out!. This is definitely the event of the year! We've been several times and its fixed in our calendar as its so much fun. Forget the horse racing, just go for people watching, champagne and a good old fashioned knees up!
A Great Day Out!. This is a great day out: an excuse to get dressed up, meet up with friends and have a fantastic time
The expats day out..... One of the best days out in the year for expats residiing in dubai. a party atmosphere joined with plenty of alcohol. a great day out.
Great night out. Would recommend this. great night out for all, great banter
The Dubai World race meeting at Meydan. Well the horse which I liked and fancied Won the Dubai World Cup for the UAE

The race of champions. The horses represent countries and the crowd is a global mix of racing buffs.. Superb venue with state of art stands and viewing options ..
very well organised ..
Dubai Gold Cup. Overpriced but a good day out with everyone dressed to thrill!
First time exp. This was my first exp of horse racing. It was fantastic. The best dressed crowd I have ever seen. A lot of fun. Its more about the social experience rather than the horse race.

Take the high seats. Spent a lot of money on Premium seats #3. Avoid this area if you want to see the race. We had 2nd row seats, which meant that someone was standing in front of us continually. Fortunately, we were able to walk around on the apron to get a better view. The bathrooms were out of order for the first 3 races - no water and trashed. I did not think the food was as bad as some of the other reviews, but it was a madhouse trying to get to the buffet. Better crowd control is required because some people refuse to queue. Beautiful facilities, but with a few kinks to work out still. The horse racing however was first rate. Everything that you would expect from the richest race in the world. Over-the-top entertainment in between races. There was a helicopter circling during the races that made it impossible to hear announcements - like having a race at an airport.

Dubai World Cup 2012, plenty of drama!. The Dubai World Cup is one of the biggest event of the Dubai social calendar and is open to everybody, the cost depends from the ticket you buy, from the simple one to the VIP areas. At the Meydan race course you will see all the social fabric of the emirates which is very interesting, and also lot of visitors because these races attract people from all over the World. You will see the most elegant ladies in Dubai in their finest outfits, some also in dreadful attires just to attract attention! At least one month before the event, which always takes place at the end of March, the tailors in town are busy, ladies are choosing dresses, shoes, trying the hats and fascinators which just arrived at M&S, Debenhams but also, for more up market, at Al Wafi mall, Burjuman and the best address in Dubai for the most beautiful hats, Eve Michele in Jumeira. The local magasines (Ahlan, Grazia...) give fashion advices for the occasion. There is a lot of anticipation and excitment in town prior to the big event and the hope for some ladies to win the best dressed, best hat prices. Before, the races used to be in Nad al Sheba but three (I think) years ago it moved to bigger and better facilities at Meydan. I went twice to the event in Nad al Sheba and liked it very much, so I was very excited for the first time at Meydan. The weather was nice which was a relief because the days before had been dusty, windy and hot and everything was going very very well until the 3rd race. One of the horse fell badly during the race, didn't get up and the race had to be cancelled. I was completely shocked because the few times I went to a big race, twice at Nad al Sheba and twice au Grand Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe at Auteuil Paris, I didn't witness an accident like that. It spoiled my pleasure a little and made me think that "un accident est si vite arrive" (an accident happens so quickly), in a second in front of your eyes. This is part of the sport of horse racing I suppose but I didn't really realised this until now. It is not only nice hats and designer dresses, there is also pain and hurt in it. I didn't stay until the end and I read later that 2 other horses were hurt when the race ,which was cancelled ,was rerun! I am not sure I would like to go again next year, the fun went a little out of it for me.

Awesome! If you don't eat.. Today we were invited for THE race. No need to highlight the venue. The best Dubai has to offer its people. Great views, fabulous track, unfortunately a horse broke its leg, Sheikh Mohammed was there, great fire works, sky diving, a stunt plane, name it. But how on earth do they dare to serve this food???? They should be ashamed! Sandwiches without fantasy, dry, boring. But even worse was the buffet diner. I went for seafood. Cheap, seared Chilian salmon, tasteless, pale. Presented by a chef of the JW Marriott. A 5* hotel. Big mistake. The sushi wasn't sushi, but a disaster, thai fish cakes, embarressing! Dim sum: if you don't know how to make it, just don't try. The only chef how's ok is the pastry chef. His chocolate mousse was great, as were the carrot cakes. The rest of the food was a big, BIG disappointment. Reducing food costs doesn't mean offending or mistreating your guest. People who paid a lot of money for a nice time out.

Ascot on steriods. The grandstand and facilities at Meydan are miles ahead of any other racecourse in the world. Around £27 will get you a gold badge which gives you access to the trendy glass fronted paddock lounge and your own seat (very comfortable) in the grandstand. The beer is expensive but having waiter service and not having throwing elbows at the bar to get a pint between races for me makes up for the extra cost. It's a very different racing experience but not necessarily better. For me the place lacks atmosphere (I went on Super Saturday 2012). In fact, I drew a few puzzled looks as a shouted my horse in, very different to Cheltenham the next week.Definitely worth a visit but for me it''s behind Longchamp, Cheltenham and York in the top racecourse stakes.

Fantasy Racing. We went to the Tiered Restaurant at Meydan for Super Saturday. This race meeting is a few weeks before the World Cup and includes some the horses running in the World Cup plus all the top jockeys including F. Dettori.The racecourse and grandstand are perfect. Almost looks unreal. Tiered Restaurant is an amazing experience. Superb seats and service. What a way to watch horse racing. A must do in Dubai even if you have no interest in horse racing.Only downside was the meal was not great but overall this did not prevent us loving the whole experience.

A great event. Have been to all of them since it moved to Meydan. Great opportunity to drew up and be seen(and watch a few who have imbibed beforehand falling off their Louboutins). The entertainment is excellent and a decent set of horses usually wins.

the horse paradise. this is a must see attraction in Dubai we were lucky the racing season only happen in march so we were able to see the races on the 17 march 2012 the final is on dubai cup on the 31 march. YOu would see what money can do , dont forget the sheick of dubai is a horse fanatic this race track cost 2,2 to 3 billions dollars with the hotel attach to it a must ssee in dubai
Loving Duba. I love the horse racing in Dubai. It's a rare chance to dress up to the nines and get to see some really good fashion, and have a great time. The horse racing is good fun too.

Colourful and buzzing. If one enjoys the races then the Dubai World Cup is world class and an international event, a must see. The Meydan is a very grand and impressive building, designed to look like a falcon, with a 5 star hotel ,all has been taken into account.

Royal Ascot with warmth. I took my daughter and her husband to Meydan in March. I determined not to stint, so pre-booked tickets for the Terrace Restaurant. What a night out, even if you are not a racing fan!A 7 course dinner - all small portions so not bloating, but all delicious. Drinks included (less champagne), a waiter devoted to our table, which overlooked the paddock, and the winning post. Excellent racing including a Group 1 Race. When I asked to leave the air conditioned terrace to go down to the paddock, an escort/guide was provided.This was racing in style and comfort. If only they had jump racing there!
horse racing. Fixture of Dubai sporting calendar, dress to impress

Best racecourse I've ever visted. I had a great night out at the horse racing.The Meydan racecourse grandstand is simply amazing. It is about half a mile long with fantastic facilities and views over the course.I sat in the Premium Seating (approx £10) and you get a great view with refreshements served at your seat if you wish. A pint of beer was about £6 though. The Pick 6 game is a bit of fun with a really good cash prize to the winner if you can pick all 6 winners.Getting back to the city centre afterwards was a bit chaotic - there seemed a lack of normal taxis so I ended up getting a private hire car which was about double the normal price. Still only about £11 to get back to city centre though.If you are a sports fan then you must visit Meydan Races.

Pure Perfection. If you want to visit the world's biggest racecourse visit Meydan. If you want to visit the world's richest horse race visit the Dubai World Cup. It is just a magic night - go and enjoy it - world class sporting action.

A night to remember forever. Went to Meydan for the Super Thursday meeting 2011 and had pre booked the tiered restaurant package for myself and my wife as part of our 25th wedding anniversary trip, paid about £160 each for 5 course meal with house wine included. The view from our table was outstanding, right over the paddock/unsaddling area with the winning post just to our right. You couldn't miss Dettori's flying dismount.The grandstand is huge, it's free to get in at the lower levels, thats where all the locals go, and you start paying the further up the chain you want to go. If you go just for premium seating, this is directly opposite to the winning post with great views, access to bars and food outlets within the grandsatnd, a siimilar set up to UK racecourses and is around £10/20 for the seat depending on the meeting.The evening started slowly as the staff were not overly attentive to the tables in our area of the restaurant and the service wasn't great, but once I had been spoken to the floor manager about this it improved sufficiently. The meal itself was good, not excellent as you might have hoped. However you go for the overall experience if you are a racing follower and this can't be faulted. Obviously no betting, gambling is illegal and websites are blocked, but if you are a regular racegoer use other methods. You are given a pick 7 competition entry form based on 7 races, which is like a jackpot, but they will pay out on less winners if nobody picks 7. I was lucky to get a return of about £100 on 4 winners because nobody got more than 5. The fun I had trying to fight my way down from the stands ,past security guards, and in to the paddock to claim my prize will live with me forever, there were 100's of locals all claiming to be one of six winners.Without the help of one of the waiters I kidnapped to help me I may never have made it. not the biggest win ever but one of the most exciting. Also very lucky to meet a couple away for their 25th as well and hopefully we'll meet again at Hamilton races and be friends for a long time. It all helped Meydan be a memorable experience.

Amazing display of money!. Living down the street from Aintree Racecourse I'm hard to impress when it comes to Horse Racing.I worked a long hard day at the Dubai World Cup in 2005 and can honestly say those people pay for what they get! The tents are fabulously decorated with gold and extravagant champagne flows like it's tap water, the luxurity is off the charts. Betting is not permitted in Dubai except by phone and so alot of the atmosphere is lost that you would expect at such an event.It's an amazing day out and I would recommend it to anyone who has a flutter during the Grand National, myself being one of them. Just be prepared for one hell of a taxi que, that's if you stay as late as we did, I think we eventually left at 12-1am.A fun day to be had and a good chance to get dressed up and feel like a millionaire!
